title: Americas Real Estate Transaction Manager
description:
**Americas Real Estate Transaction Manager:**

At BNY, our culture empowers you to grow and succeed. As a leading global financial services company at the center of the world’s financial system we touch nearly 20% of the world’s investible assets. Every day around the globe, our 50,000+ employees bring the power of their perspective to the table to create solutions with our clients that benefit businesses, communities and people everywhere.


We continue to be a leader in the industry, awarded as a top home for innovators and for creating an inclusive workplace. Through our unique ideas and talents, together we help make money work for the world. This is what #LifeAtBNY is all about.


We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Transaction Manager to join our team. This role is located in New York, NY, and is a Hybrid Position.


**In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:**

* Responsible for all activities supporting acquisition and disposal of the real estate portfolio and space needs across business units, geographies and regions
* Uses extensive industry experience to propose effective solutions to optimize the real estate portfolio while ensuring business needs are met and critical dates are evaluated
* Develops and fosters well-established relationships with global and regional leaders to effectively communicate and execute the agreed real estate strategies
* Advises senior business managers and partners along with functional leaders to successfully execute commercially sound real estate transactions
* Partners with key finance and accounting personnel on annual budgeting, capital planning and all financial impacts of regional real estate strategies and transactions
* In the course of the transaction execution, partners with key functional colleagues in design and construction, engineering, facilities management and corporate services and ensures an appropriate level of awareness among senior management throughout the organization
* Recognized within the business and across the industry as a leader who drives value-added real estate solutions and meets all compliance and regulatory requirements; well versed in the real estate brokerage business
* Responsible for day to day management of outsourced real estate transactions partners

**To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:**

* BA required; Masters, MBA or other advanced degree preferred
* 10+ years in the commercial real estate business as a corporate real estate professional or real estate asset manager
* Seasoned transactions management experience
* Proved skills in contract review and lease/purchase and sale negotiations
* Solid understanding of financial and accounting impacts; high level of business acumen
* Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
* Excellent negotiating, analytical, communication, collaboration, organizational/planning and process skills
* Outstanding client service skills and team leadership
Advanced computer skills (MS Office, including Excel, Word, Power Point and Outlook)  
* 

  

At BNY, our culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:


* America’s Most Innovative Companies, Fortune, 2024
* World’s Most Admired Companies, Fortune 2024
* Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Corporate Equality Index, 100% score, 2023-2024
* Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion , Disability: IN – 100% score, 2023-2024
* “Most Just Companies”, Just Capital and CNBC, 2024
* Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, Top performing company for Sustainability, 2024
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI), 2023  
* 

  

Our Benefits and Rewards:


BNY offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves, including paid volunteer time, that can support you and your family through moments that matter.


BNY is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.  



  

BNY assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $122,000 and $250,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNY total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.
  

This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

title: Medical Receptionist/Biller - Part Time or Full Time
description:
Looking for Part Time or Full Time Medical Receptionist. **Reliability is very important**. Candidates **must** be computer savvy with knowledge of Gmail, Google Docs, Excel/Sheets, and use of smartphone apps. Experience as a Medical Assistant or with Medical Billing is preferred, but willing to train the right candidate. Spanish speaking a plus.

We provide a friendly work environment, and allow candidates to work independently without micromanaging. Paid holidays, PTO, competitive bonus structures available.

**Job duties will include the following:**

- Answering phones

- Collecting payment on copays/deductibles and sales

- Making and confirming appointments

- Updating patient records

- Sterilization of instruments

- Inventory and supply ordering

- Prepare and clean treatment rooms between patients

- Insurance verification and billing

- Insurance authorizations

Will be hiring in the next 2 weeks, so don't hesitate to send in your resume today.

title: Global Derivatives Intern – US Options
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Building trusted markets — powered by our people.**


At Cboe Global Markets, we inspire our people to solve complex challenges together because what we do matters. We provide the financial infrastructure that powers the global economy. As a leading provider of market infrastructure and tradable products, Cboe delivers cutting-edge trading, clearing and investment solutions to market participants around the world.


Cboe interns work with a variety of staff across multiple departments and have the opportunity to put their skills to work in their field of interest, while learning about Exchange technology and operations through our robust Options Institute courses.


The three main foundational pillars of our internship program are: develop, educate and network. We want to ensure each of our interns receive a real-world working experience that encourages academic, professional and personal growth.


Candidates should be versatile, eager and able to work in a fast-paced, time-sensitive financial and technical environment. Our interns will have the flexibility of working 2 days remotely, and 3 days in office per week at one of our state-of-the-art offices in Chicago, Kansas City, and New York City. To be eligible for this internship, applicants must be enrolled in a university or college program and should not be scheduled to graduate before December of the year in which the internship takes place. Our internship program runs from June to August, and you will wrap up your internship with a final presentation and retreat. Visit our student page for more information about our internship program!

**The Options Business team is hiring for a Global Derivatives Intern – US Options:**


As a Global Derivatives Intern focuses on US Options, you will engage directly in the analysis of market trends and transactional pricing within the US-listed options markets. You will work alongside the Options Business team, collaborating with sales, coverage, and market structure teams. This hands-on experience will allow you to contribute to pricing strategies and operational optimizations that enhance our competitive positioning in the marketplace.


The Options Business team plays a critical role in strategic initiatives at Cboe, focusing on comprehensive market analysis and the development of transactional pricing strategies. Dedicated to maintaining a competitive edge, the team regularly interacts with key stakeholders to adapt and refine strategies that meet evolving market needs. By fostering a culture of innovation and dynamic problem-solving, we offer interns a unique environment to develop professional skills and contribute meaningful insights.

**Your responsibilities and learning objectives will be:**

* Participating in a variety of projects within the US Listed Options Business to support strategic initiatives and enhance business operations.
* Working closely with Derivatives team members on building financial models to support changes that enhance our competitive positioning.
* Collaborating with multiple teams to design and build reporting dashboards to track customer engagement and experience across our trading markets.

**The ideal candidate has:**

* Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in STEM, Finance, or a related field and should not be scheduled to graduate before December of the year in which the internship takes place.
* A keen interest in global financial markets with an emphasis on derivatives.
* Familiarity working with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Sigma) to analyze data and build visualization dashboards.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and foundational coding skills, particularly in SQL, Python or other languages conducive for analyzing large datasets.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, work effectively both independently and as part of a team, and demonstrate excellent communication skills.
* A proactive, resourceful approach to work with a quick aptitude for recognizing and resolving issues.

**You’ll really stand out with:**

* Experience in financial markets (equities, options, futures, etc.)

**Benefits and Perks**

* Competitive compensation
* Flexible, hybrid work environment, 3 days in office, 2 days remote, per week.
* 2:1 401(k) match, up to 8% match immediately upon hire.


Some of our employees’ favorite benefits and perks include:

* Daily complimentary in-office lunch from local restaurants
* Endless free coffee and snacks to fuel your workday
* Monthly in office networking events and happy hours
* Associate Resource Groups (ARGs) and affinity groups for support and community building

**More About Cboe Global Markets**


We’re reimagining the future of the workplace by focusing on what matters most, our people. Our journey is an inclusive one. We’re investing deeply in leadership programs and career development initiatives that ensure everyone has an equal chance to succeed. We celebrate the diversity in our communities, inside and out, and welcome new perspectives with equity, inclusion and belonging.


We work with purpose, solving problems with ingenuity, collaboration, and a lot of passion. We’re an engaged and excited team connecting markets across borders and embracing growth in all its forms to achieve incredible outcomes.


Learn more about life at Cboe on our website, LinkedIn, and our student page for more information about our internship program!

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status.


As required by the New York City Human Rights Law, Cboe provides a reasonable range of minimum base salary for roles that may be performed in New York City. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to geographic location, skill set, level of experience, etc. For New York City only, the range of starting base salary for this role is $24 to $36 an hour. Additional incentive compensation and benefits may be available.


#LI-HL


#Hybrid

 *Any communication from Cboe regarding this position will only come from a Cboe recruiter who has a @cboe.com email or via LinkedIn Recruiter. Cboe does not use any other**third party communication tools for recruiting purposes.*

**The Market Data & Access Services team is hiring for a Market Data & Access Services intern:**


The Market Data & Access Services business is positioned within the Data & Access Solutions (DnA) Division and is responsible for product, pricing, policy, and business operations across our markets globally. This includes access to the Cboe Exchanges and distribution of Cboe Data across multiple asset classes – including Equities, Options, Futures, FX, and Indices. We are a global team supporting a wide spectrum of global clients, with a focus on data and connectivity product development, functionality enhancements, policy changes, and continuous pricing evaluation. While this position will be focused on North America, there will be opportunities to work on behalf of the global business as needed.

**Your responsibilities and learning objectives will be:**

* Assist with various projects and product initiatives that impact multiple areas of the business.
* Assist with market research and analysis.
* Research and maintain competitive data and connectivity product summaries including descriptions, pricing, customer targets, etc.
* Contribute to financial forecasting, budget process, revenue projections, and business trend analysis.
* Develop complex pricing models to include multiple variable inputs and outputs to fully assess business impact of various changes.
* Review and assist in the process of drafting commercial contracts, policies, and legal filings in coordination with the legal team.
* Document requirements, meeting notes, agendas, and action items for various stakeholders – both internally and externally as needed.
* Support the Operational Team as needed through assisting in customer onboarding, customer inquiries, and helping to drive operational efficiencies.
* Respond directly to customers regarding product, pricing, policy, and/or billing-related questions, requests, and/or issues.
* Interact with a wide range of global clients and prospective customers including exchanges, data vendors, sell-side brokers, buy-side firms, market makers, proprietary traders, retail brokers, financial websites, and fintech.

* Undergraduate (rising junior or senior) or Graduate student working towards a degree in business, economics, finance, computer science, quantitative analysis, or a related field and should not be scheduled to graduate before December of the year in which the internship takes place.
* Strong communication skills
* Strong research and analysis skills
* Strong knowledge of Excel
* Working knowledge of other Microsoft Office products
* Working knowledge of Tableau, Sigma, or other Data Visualization Tools
* Working knowledge of Python
* Attention to detail
* Ability to handle multiple assignments

* Expert in Business Analysis and Data Visualization through tools such as Tableau and/or Sigma

title: Recruiting and Onboarding Coordinator
description:
**Recruiter**
=============



Are you passionate about finding top talent and driving the growth of an organization? Join Diamond Braces as a Recruiter! Enjoy a dynamic role where you’ll have the opportunity to identify, attract, and hire the best candidates. Ready to make a meaningful impact on our team? We’d love to meet you!


**Why Diamond Braces?**
-----------------------



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our practice, ensuring we hire individuals who align with our values and commitment to providing world-class orthodontic care.


**What We Offer:**
------------------


* Competitive salary based on experience and qualification
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Supportive work environment

**Essential Functions:**
------------------------


* Talent Acquisition: Source, attract, and interview candidates for various roles across the organization, ensuring the best fit for each position.
* Candidate Screening: Review applications, resumes, and cover letters, conducting initial interviews to assess candidate qualifications and fit with the company culture.
* Hiring Process Management: Coordinate and manage the full recruitment cycle, from posting job ads to extending offers and onboarding new hires.
* Collaboration with Hiring Managers: Work closely with department heads to understand staffing needs and create strategies for fulfilling these requirements.
* Employer Branding: Represent Diamond Braces at job fairs, recruitment events, and on social media platforms to build the company’s employer brand.
* Maintain Recruitment Metrics: Track key metrics, such as time-to-hire and candidate satisfaction, to continuously improve the recruitment process.
* Compliance: Ensure all recruitment practices adhere to employment laws and internal policies, maintaining accurate records and documentation.
* Candidate Experience: Maintain a positive experience for all candidates, regardless of the outcome of their application, by providing timely communication and feedback.

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------


* Previous experience in recruitment, preferably within the healthcare or dental industry.
* Strong understanding of recruitment techniques, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and recruitment software.
* Ability to manage multiple roles and priorities simultaneously.
* Commitment to providing an outstanding candidate experience.

**Who We Are:**
---------------



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service—the **'AAA Experience.'** We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


**Additional Information:**
---------------------------



This position is full-time, with opportunities for remote work.  

Salary is based on experience, skills, and qualifications.  

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.  

If you’re ready to find the talent that will help our team shine, apply today!

title: Administrative Receptionist for a Cosmetic Dermatology Practice
description:
Busy Dermatology practice specializing in cosmetic and general dermatology seeking a full-time receptionist with administrative experience. The candidate will provide administrative support to patients, PFRANKMD employees, and referral sources through the coordination and administration of the practice manager. The ideal candidate will have experience in an administrative role, as well as strong computer skills and customer service. Tasks include: scheduling appointments, validating insurance and payment authorization, inputting insurance claims, processing payments, performing account collections, conducting billing research and responding to telephone inquiries.

Responsibilities

* Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, all or some of the following.
* Greet and welcome patients
* Handle all incoming phone calls, scheduling-related tasks, and online leads efficiently, while maintaining a positive phone call experience.
* Transferring calls and inquiries to providers and care coordinators.
* Understand the provider-to-patient flow
* Scanning, updating, and filing medical records.
* Perform inventory responsibilities and stocking of supplies and equipment as requested
* Processing medical insurance information
* Direct all medical billing inquiries to the appropriate billing department staff.
* Collecting detailed patient information, including personal and financial information, to schedule new patients and update existing patient information.
* Entering and updating patient data in the system in a timely and accurate manner.
* Assisting patients with completion of paperwork when necessary.
* Assisting other practice team members as needed.
* Adhere to compliance guidelines throughout processes (OSHA, HIPAA)
* Assist with insurance billing coordination

Qualifications

* Covid 19 Vaccination Required
* In-person position
* 1-3 years of experience with EMR software and patient scheduling systems.
* Excellent listening, communication, and organizational skills.
* Flexible/adaptable nature to work in a fast paced and continuously evolving environment.
* Passion for helping others in a healthcare environment.
* Ability to effectively interact with providers, patients and other staff members.
* Knowledge of OSHA, and HIPAA compliance
* Working knowledge of HIPAA and other medical insurance regulations for billing and reimbursement protocols.

Benefits

* Health Insurance
* Discretionary Bi-Annual Bonus
* Paid-Time Off

Salary: $13.20 - $27.57 per hour

* Paid time off

* Weekend availability

title: Level II-Armed Security Officer (Westbury, NY)
description:
**Overview**

A Rewarding New Career Opportunity at SecTek!

SecTek, Inc. protects our nation’s most prestigious and high-visibility government and commercial facilities. We are trusted for our commitment and chosen for our accountability. Become part of a team of first-class Security professionals! Start your career with SecTek today!

SecTek intends to change the non-economic terms.

**Job Description**

EEOC Classification: Service Workers

**Summary:**

The FAA Security Officer position at the FAA post is responsible for providing security and to safeguard FAA employees, facilities, Government property and assets from loss, theft, damage, unauthorized use, criminal acts, espionage, sabotage and terrorism. FAA Security Officers will conduct visitor and vehicle control and screening, monitor and respond to facility cameras and alarms from intrusion detection systems,perform magnetometer and X-Ray screening, and other duties as outlined in the Statement of Work. Must possess a good working knowledge of security operations, safety practices in a business environment and enforcement procedures.

**Essential Tasks** (minimum requirements to be performed with or without reasonable accommodation):

1. Access Control-Provide courteous, timely service while maintaining control of all personnel and vehicles entering the facility in accordance with the local Facility Security Plan.

2. Screening-Check hand carried items in possession of visitors, operate metal detectors/magnetometers to inspect visitors and deliveries, operate x-ray machine to inspect visitors’ packages, equipment and hand-carried articles, conduct vehicle inspections, and conduct broader or more detailed screening as directed by the ATR in response to the security posture.

3. Visitor Processing- Follow proper site procedures for issuing visitor badges to visitors.

4. roving patrols of the facility perimeter to detect unauthorized entry or other  
suspicious activities, inspect physical security safeguards, inspect facilities for hazards, ensure that all security equipment is activated and operating  
properly, closing and securing all open windows or doors, manually open and close heavy gates and doors, patrol locations in areas which are potentially hazardous to the public, observe the environment for suspicious vehicles or persons on Federal property, review maps, floor plans, diagrams to be familiar with facility and property boundaries.

5. Response-evacuate individuals from dangerous and/or life threatening situations, guide and assist First Responders, administer cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR), administer/deploy automatic external defibrillator (AED), assess the medical condition of injured individuals, perform basic first aid in response to emergencies.

6. Control Operations-Provide written or verbal situation reports regarding security-related information (e.g. accidents, bomb threats, unlawful acts, characteristics of individuals).

7. Inspections-buildings and grounds, vehicles, execute colors, traffic, parking and pedestrian control.

8. Escort Services-May have to escort deliveries to the loading dock.

9. Gate/Building Openings-must open/close gate(s) and building(s) within the time parameters as specified by the Facility Post Orders.

10. Key/Access Control Cards/Combination Control-Must receive, secure, issue and account for all keys/access cards or combinations issued to them for access to buildings, offices, equipment, gates, etc.

11. Screening of Vehicles, Visitors and Mail-Deny entry of unauthorized person(s), property or vehicles to area(s) defined in the Facility Post Orders.

12. Temporary Badges-Issuance of temporary passes and temporary badges to Government employees, authorized visitors, issue appropriate identification badges to authorized visitors, and record required.

13. Private Property-follow procedures for handling of private property (audio, video recording devices, cameras, etc.) prohibited on the facility unless authorized by the FM.

14. Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Position Requirements:**

1. Required to meet the requirements of the FAA Statement of Work.

2. Ability to perform duties in a professional manner, appearance, and exercise sound judgment.

3. Must be a U.S. citizen.

4. Must meet all federal, state, and local requirements for Security Officers.

5. Required to have proof of experience (must meet one (1) or more of the following requirements and provide proof):

6. Three (3) years of security experience within the past five (5) years OR

7. Associate degree in related field, plus one (1) year of experience OR

8. Three (3) years of military experience (Active, Reserve, or National Guard) OR

9. Successful completion of a State certified Police Officer’s Standard Training (POST) certification course OR

10. Possess a reasonable combination of one (1) through three (3) as agreed to by the COR.

11. Must be least 21 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license.

12. Possess or able to successfully obtain all FAA Training Requirements, and to remain in compliance of their training.

13. Successfully pass all Personnel and Industrial Security Requirements, such as Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) fingerprint check and Office of Personnel Management National Agency Check with Inquiries (NACI), to be granted an interim suitability approval. Be able to obtain an FAA Personal Identity Verification  
card (PIV).

14. Hold and maintain Active Armed New York Security Guard status.

15. Maintain poise and self-control under stress.

16. Speak English fluently and is able to read and understand written English in reports, orders, guidelines, and instructions.

17. Ability to understand and follow standard operating procedures.

18. Input and retrieve data using computerized security system and read, understand, and apply printed instructions, rules, detailed orders, and training materials.

19. Ability to write official reports in English that are grammatically correct and technically accurate.

20. Possess a high school diploma or General Education Development (GED) Certificate from a duly accredited institution.

21. Ability to make independent and good judgment decisions utilizing the FAA Security Officer Manual and ADC LTD NM and customer policy and procedures.

22. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information.

**Common Tasks** 

1. Provide directions or information to tenants or visitors.

2. Advise people relative to problems, situations, etc.

3. Explain rules, regulations, and procedures to individuals.

4. Conduct on-the-spot interviews of witnesses to obtain description of possible suspects or description of events and persons surrounding security incidents for reporting to first responders and/or Government authorities.

5. Collect information about stolen or missing property or suspicious activities to aid investigations.

6. Advise the Site Supervisor or the duty facility manager of potentially hazardous conditions.

7. Raise and lower the flag in a respectful and appropriate manner.

8. Locate and review documents and information (e.g., logs, lists).

9. Read memos and other written material issued by the ATR to maintain knowledge.

10. Take detailed field notes so reports and/or log entries can be completed.

11. Provide backup assistance to other CSOs.

12. Recognize and report unsolicited contacts (telephone, in person, and by mail) to determine suspected criminal and/or suspicious activity that poses a potential threat to the organization's facilities or personnel.

13. Interview and assess suspicious persons.

14. Draw and discharge weapons to protect self or third party on FAA property.

15. Participate in firearms training and demonstrate proficiencies.

16. Care for and maintain firearms.

17. Participate in training in the use of chemical agents, restraining devices, and batons for use in emergency situations.

18. Use OC (Oleoresin Capsicum) chemical in gel or foam spray pattern only to temporarily incapacitate a violent individual in accordance with state and local laws.

19. Use baton as a defensive weapon or to temporarily disable a violent individual.

20. Inventory physical objects (e.g., keys, keycards, vehicles, visitor badges) and log

21. Testify in court regarding criminal activity or other incidents.

22. Participate in work-related training.

23. Report misconduct of other Contract Security Officers

**Physical Demands and Working Conditions:**

The physical demands described here and below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel or operate objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk and listen.

· Frequent and prolonged walking, standing, sitting, and stooping, up to twelve (12) hours per day, either indoors or outdoors, during daytime or nighttime. Outdoor posts may require an individual to withstand extreme heat, humidity, cold, or severe weather (e.g., snow, sleet, rain, hail, wind).

· Frequent contact with general public, law enforcement, and dispatch center, requiring an ability to speak clearly and distinctly and remain calm in stressful situations (e.g., confrontations with angry, distraught, disturbed, or violent persons).

· Abilit to remain on post up to four (4) consecutive hours without sitting, eating, or relieving bladder or bowels.

· Ability to remain alert for up to twelve (12) hours, with ability to mentally and physically react quickly to a variety of unexpected and dangerous situations. Use of senses (sight, hearing, smell, touch) is necessary to discern unusual or dangerous situations.

· Ability to use post security equipment (metal detectors, X-rays, CCTV), ability to use handcuffs, baton, and firearm at any time while on duty.

· Ability to read post assignments, write reports, and respond to both routine and emergency dispatches or orders.

· Ability to subdue violent or potentially violent or disturbed individuals, or intervene in a crisis (e.g., provide emergency First Aid or resuscitation while waiting for the arrival of paramedics or other emergency personnel).

· Occasional running, sprinting, lifting heavy weights, moving heavy objects, climbing stairs (e.g., in responding to emergencies, ensuring timely and complete facility evacuations, giving pursuit, etc.).

· Evening and Weekend Hours required.

**Security Clearance:**

The position requires security clearance.

SecTek Security is required by FAA to conduct a pre-employment drug test and background review that includes checks of personal references, credit, law enforcement records,

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $28.76 per hour

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Queens, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Nurse Manager Inpatient Care
description:
**Job Description**


Under the general supervision of the Chief Nursing Officer, the Nurse Manager is responsible for the overall administrative direction of inpatient Med/Surg, Telemetry, and ICU units at CareWell Health Medical Center. The **Nurse Manager** manages nursing practice and operations in their designated units. This includes, but is not limited to, the management of clinical nursing practice, staff recruitment, retention, labor relations, supply chain and budget, staffing, employee performance evaluation, quality improvement, staff education, medical records, and internal and external regulatory and survey requirements.


The **Nurse Manager** collaborates with multiple professionals to support and coordinate the provision/management of patient care. He or she is responsible for maintaining the highest standards of patient care and is responsive to the needs of the patient & family and the organization.

  


The **Nurse Manager** is the Nursing Leader of their designated unit /service and has the ability to create and empower teams to embrace and implement change that will improve the clinical, operational, and financial performance. Leads nursing practice using the established Care Team Care Delivery Model for the promotion of the patient experience for nursing operations. Synthesizes quantitative and qualitative feedback regarding the patient experience and staff engagement and creates programs to improve, measure, and monitor staff performance.


**Essential Functions**


* Role models service standards in actions and communications with patients, families, staff, and other disciplines.
* Functions as a respectful leader of the health care team.
* Participates in hospital committees and projects, and hospital-wide implementation programs.
* Coordinates and facilitates activities to promote service and interdisciplinary teamwork.
* Works collaboratively, demonstrating partnerships with physician leadership and service line administrative staff to develop and maintain clinical practice standards of care and operational programs.
* Establishes collaborative relationships with nursing staff, leadership, medical staff, and other administrative staff and throughout the medical center.
* Participates in designing new clinical facilities and renovating existing facilities to represent a patient care and nursing perspective.
* Hires, develops, and evaluates nursing leadership from orientation through termination, if necessary, according to established standards.
* Establishes accountability while providing support and guidance for role advancement and professional development of formal and aspiring leadership.
* Coordinates activities pertaining to patient care based on the hospital's and the Department of Nursing's philosophy and mission.
* Contributes to recruitment and retention through advocacy with other departments on behalf of nursing to optimize systems that contribute to patient care delivery. Initiates and sustains structure standards for the department, service line, service, and unit level.
* Manages staff productivity utilizing the Labor Productivity Tool. Adjust staffing as needed.
* Demonstrates visibility, accessibility, and effective communication that conveys a strong sense of advocacy and support for staff and leadership.
* Systematically evaluates the quality and effectiveness of nursing staff practices
* Participates in and/or leads interdisciplinary quality and performance improvement projects pertinent to the Department's goals and objectives.
* Participates in and fosters staff involvement in evidence-based practice and other nursing research activities.
* Supports academic affiliations to provide clinically rich experiences for nursing students and enrichment of nursing staff.
* Maintain clinical and leadership competency by participating in continuing education, professional organizations, and other related activities.
* Facilitates an environment of learning that supports patient safety, and all levels of nursing practice and personnel.
* Fosters opportunities for staff and leadership participation in activities and educational programs that promote learning and professional development.
* Reviews protocols, policies, procedures, and standards of practice to ensure compliance with the New Jersey State Nurse Practice Act
* Understands and articulates patient care standards reflected in federal and state regulation, The Joint Commission, and organizational policies and procedures.
* Work with CareWell Health physicians to build relationships, monitor performance, improve processes, and solve problems.
* Ensure assigned areas of responsibility comply with the company’s Compliance Program.
* Follows up on all patient concerns promptly, provides service recovery as needed, and escalates patient concerns as appropriate.
* Demonstrates caring, respect, compassion, empathy, and active listening through dialogue, body language, and actions.
* Other duties as assigned by the Chief Nursing Officer.


**Other Duties**


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.


**Minimum Education/Certifications**


Master’s degree preferred (MBA, MHA, or MSN similar degree from an accredited university).


Valid Registered Nursing License in New Jersey.


National Certification in the area of specialty is preferred (i.e., NEA-BC, NE-BC).


**Minimum Work Experience**


Minimum of 2 to 5 years as a Registered Nurse in Medical Surgical, Telemetry, or Critical Care.


Minimum of 3 to 4 years of progressive leadership experience in healthcare (i.e., preceptor, charge nurse, clinical coordinator, or assistant nurse manager roles).


**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**


* Knowledge of fiscal planning, analysis, and management principles
* Ability to work in a fast-moving (and sometimes ambiguous) environment while managing toward clarity and solutions.
* Knowledge of healthcare management principles and practices is enough to direct operations within a healthcare organization.
* Ability to communicate effectively to various audiences in small and large groups.
* Ability to exercise a high degree of initiative, sound judgment, discretion, and decision-making skills
* Ability to solve management issues and direct numerous and varied operations simultaneously
* Ability to set and maintain high standards of performance, hold people accountable for achieving deliverable metrics, encourage team participation, and motivate others through a shared vision
* Knowledge of human resource management practices and related regulatory and compliance requirements
* Possesses and maintains current knowledge of healthcare industry operations and trends.

  




**Physical Requirements and Working Conditions**


* May be required to sit for long periods of time.
* May be required to kneel, bend, crouch, crawl, reach, or climb.
* May be required to stand or walk for a good portion of the workday.
* May be required to exert significant force to push, pull, or lift objects or move patients.
* May be subject to more of the following conditions: fumes, odors, dust, mists, gases, or poor ventilation.
* May be exposed to mechanical, electrical, biological, or chemical hazards.
* May be subject to extreme temperature conditions indoors and/or outdoors, such as extreme heat or cold and exposure to weather elements.
* May be required to operate machinery or equipment.
* Exposed to unpleasant odors and communicable diseases.
* Encounters stress, crisis, emergencies, and death.
* Lifts equipment/supplies as needed.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:** Full-time, 37.5 hours/per week

  

  

Location: CareWell Health · Nursing Administration  

Schedule: Full Time, Regular, Days, 8:30 am-4:30pm

title: Teaching Assistant
company: The YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester
description:
The YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester is a charitable, not-for-profit organization serving 66 zip codes in Putnam and Westchester counties. The YMCA of CNW is committed to youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility. We are looking for a committed UPK Teacher to complement our qualified workforce of educators.

The **UPK Assistant Teacher** is responsible for the delivery of a safe and developmentally high-quality UPK educational experience for the children. This is a ten-month, seasonal position.

**UPK Assistant Teacher Job Duties:**

* Assist the UPK Teacher in all daily preschool program activities, including academic enrichment, physical activity, arts & crafts, and more.
* Provide a safe, healthy, and fun environment for all children while supervising and maintaining licensing regulations.
* Be a positive role model for the children in the classroom
* Foster the four YMCA character values of respect, responsibility, caring, and honesty within the program participants.
* Follow all YMCA policies and procedures, including those related to medical situations and emergency procedures.

**UPK Assistant Teacher Benefits:**

* Ten-month seasonal position
* Professional development
* Hands-on experience
* Convenient locations

**UPK Assistant Teacher Qualifications:**

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* Pursuing Bachelor's and or Degree in Early Childhood Education
* Associate's Degree in Early Childhood Education
* Child Development Certificate (CDA) in Preschool
* Excellent Customer Service, interpersonal and communications skills

title: Customer Service-Self Storage Manager
description:
**Company Description** **Public Storage** is the self-storage industry leader and we are **Hiring Now!**

**Earn $16.50 Per Hour**

**Our Benefits**


Total Rewards package available to our team:

* We work Flexible and **Full-Time Schedules** between the hours of 9:30am and 6pm (weekends ‘til 5pm)
* **Competitive wages paid weekly**
* Employees become eligible forFull-time **Benefits** by working an average of 20+ hours - Benefits include:
	+ Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with match, paid time off, sick time, and flex spending
	+ Company paid life, accidental death insurance, and exclusive vendor discounts
* **Mileage reimbursement** is provided when traveling between properties or other work-related tasks
* On-site company housing is available to employees at many of our locations (performance and tenure required for eligibility)
* Our Property Managers have the opportunity to earn performance-based **bonuses!**

  

**Job Description**  

* Our Property Managers get to work independently at multiple locations; spending time both inside and outside
* We assess customer storage needs and make suggestions, including selling packing and moving supplies
* Daily storage unit inspections to confirm inventory and availability helps make sure spaces are ready to rent
* Auditing cash drawers and making bank deposits are part of the daily business
* We help keep our customers current with payments and make reminder and collection calls when required

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to transport lift/move items weighing up to 35 pounds
* Our property managers should be able to walk in/around facilities spending up to 50% of their time in outdoor environments, including climbing stairs and opening large doors.
* Performing cleaning and daily maintenance tasks: including sweeping/mopping interior areas and maintain exterior grounds/curb appeal clean and free of debris.

  

**Qualifications** **Experience:** Successful candidates come from a variety of customer service centered sales environments including retail, restaurant, fast food or other service-based companies.

**Transportation:** Our employees are **required** to have a valid driver’s license and utilize their own vehicle to travel between different work locations and/or while conducting other work-related business. (mileage reimbursement available)

 **Additional Information** **More about Us!**  

Public Storage was recognized as A Great Place to Work by the Great Place to Work Institute. Our employees have also voted us as having Best Career Growth, ranked us in the Top 5% for Work Culture, and in the Top 10% for Diversity and Inclusion.

**Apply Now** for an opportunity to join **Public Storage** and be a part of the self-storage industry’s #1 team!

title: PM Duty Manager
description:
Vista is the premier hospitality management company of the Americas. As owners and operators of hotels, Vista has carved a remarkable story of success. Vista encourages employee growth as a contributing factor to both the success of the individual as well as success of the team. Vista owns and managers several properties throughout Eastern United States and Canada. For more information, please visit our website at www.vistahospitality.com.

Radisson/Doubletree JFK, one of Vista Hospitality’s portfolios of hotels, is currently seeking an energetic, service-oriented and results-driven PM Duty Manager. Radisson/Doubletree JFK offers a competitive compensation package and a working environment that’s all about hospitality! Take the next step in your career and join our team!

**ESSENTIAL PURPOSE:** To be responsible for all aspects of hotel operations during the evening shift with direct responsibility for the management of the Front Office, Transportation, Housekeeping, Engineering, and Food & Beverage departments. This position as Operations/ PM Duty Manager reports to the Assistant General Manager and General Manager.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES:**

· Directs and coordinates hotels activities to obtain optimum efficiency and economy of operations, and maximize full potential with a balanced focus on hotels mission, guests, employees and owner’s satisfaction.

· To understand and respond to all guest needs and requests in a timely and professional manner.

· To provide gracious and sincere customer service to all arriving hotel guests, including offering assistance of a bellperson (if applicable); giving directions to guest rooms, restaurants, and other hotel facilities.

· To ensure the proper handling of guest check-ins by Front Desk staff, including welcoming guests, obtaining identification and establishing credit; accurately completing all necessary paperwork; accurately entering

· information into PMS; and ensuring guest satisfaction with rooms and other arrangements.

· To perform other tasks, including cross-training, as directed.

· Assist the General Manager in day-to-day operations.

· Promotes the property within the hotel industry, local community and trade associations.

· Monitor and respond to the guest feedback on Trip advisor, OTA's etc. and brand NPS surveys, if needed.

· Responsible for maintaining brand service score requirements.

· Receives and resolves or assists the General Manager & AGM in resolving guest complaints and service recovery process.

· Assisting General Manager & AGM during daily meetings or conducts the shift HOD meetings in the absence of General Manager.

· Adheres to all franchise and company procedures and regulations as well as standard operating procedures.

· Ensure full compliance to hotel operating controls and service standards.

· Ensures the objectives and goals to achieve brand positioning and success.

· Builds owner loyalty through proactive communication, setting and managing expectations and delivering solid business results.

· Assist GM in key property issues including capital projects, customer service and refurbishment.

· Performs daily, weekly and monthly property inspections.

· Ensures property, grounds, physical plant and work areas maintained to standard.

· Builds strong working relationships and communications with hotel staff, HOD's and other departments to ensure maximum operating effectiveness and fulfilment of special event need.

· Monitor maintenance progress and FF&E (Furniture, Furnishings, and Equipment) conditions and provide status report to GM.

· Audits on par stock on all areas to make sure that all required hotel supplies are ordered and stocked in advance of need.

· Performs sudden audits on rooms and other operating areas.

· Provide effective leadership to hotel team members.

· Ensure hotel staff is provided with uniforms and upholds property grooming standards.

· Must be available 24/7 in case to respond to any guest emergencies.

· Corporate client handling and take part in new client acquisition along with the sales team whenever required.

· Assisting in sales as and when required and development with strong sales prospects.

· Respond to audits to ensure continual improvement is achieved.

· Completes all other duties as assigned by the General Manager or other Management.

* Works closely with Airlines and Airline partners, such as 3rd parties to book rooms at the best available terms and rates.

**JOB KNOWLEDGE & EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:** Bachelor's degree in Hotel or Business Management, or equivalent experience, required. English fluency required. Bi-lingual is an added benefit. Must have minimum three years’ experience in hotel front desk position, including one year in supervisory capacity. Must be computer literate and be proficient in hotel software systems.

· **SKILLS AND APTITUDES:** Demonstrated ability to train staff and ensure seamless customer service. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Detail oriented. Organized and efficient.

· Safety-minded. High quality standards for production and service. Good team player. Customer service focus. Ability to effectively manage staff to maintain a high level of morale and productivity.

**WORKING CONDITIONS:** Works indoors throughout shift, in temperature-controlled, clean, and well-lighted office and Front Desk area. Bi-level structures. Extensive facility.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** Stands/walks short to long distances approximately 80% of shift. Sits at desk or in meetings approximately 10% of shift. Moderate use of phones, daily. Uses personal computer approximately 10% of shift. Frequent use of stairs, daily. Must be flexible to work long, sometimes irregular hours. Must be able to work well under pressure.

**PREREQUISITES:**

Strong management skills are a MUST!

Ability to appropriately assign/delegate work and authority to others in the accomplishment of goals.

Ability to provide training and/or coaching as required.

Available to work a flexible work schedule which will include working weekends, holidays and nights.

**EDUCATION:**

A University Degree or Diploma in Hotel Management or;

A University Degree or Diploma in Financial Accounting with working experience in personnel supervision and problem resolutions (as an added advantage).

***Radisson JFK Airport*** *is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability or veteran status.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Jamaica, NY 11436: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Executive Director of Art, Flatiron
description:
Flatiron Books is looking for an Executive Director of Art with a passion for a broad range of books and book cover design. The ideal candidate has a strong background in art, design, layout and typography and can both produce original art concepts and art direct across various categories in fiction and nonfiction. This role requires strong communication and project management skills and the ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders.


**What you'll do:**


* Design and art direct book jackets and covers for a wide array of exciting fiction and non-fiction titles. Categories include (but are not limited to) literary fiction, commercial fiction, mysteries and thrillers, celebrity memories, self-help, and cookbooks.
* Assign and oversee work from staff and freelance designers, illustrators, artists, and photographers.
* Work collaboratively with editorial, managing editorial and production teams, and evaluate and improve processes for greater efficiency.
* Prepare and review jacket files for press.
* Art direct photo shoots, as needed.
* Adhere to deadlines and budgets.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with Flatiron staff and outside contacts.


**What you'll bring:**


* Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders.
* A strong design skillset, including proficiency in typography, image creation and manipulation, and image research/photo editing.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, especially InDesign and Photoshop.
* Ideal candidate must be familiar with the adult trade market.
* The ability to take in feedback from multiple sources and come up with creative solutions.
* Excellent project management skills, extremely well organized, able to manage many projects simultaneously.


**Ideal experience/education:**


* At least 7 years of design experience in book publishing, or equivalent print media (magazine, newspaper, etc.)
* At least 2-3 years of art directing and managing designers.
* Proficiency with the technological and production aspects of print media.


This role will have an annual salary of $170,000 - $185,000.



Macmillan Publishers is the U.S. trade company that is part of the Holtzbrinck Publishing Group, a large family-owned group of media companies headquartered in Stuttgart, Germany. Holtzbrinck Publishing Group's publishing companies include prominent imprints around the world that publish a broad range of award-winning books for children and adults in all categories and formats.



U.S. publishers include Celadon Books, Farrar, Straus and Giroux, Flatiron Books, Henry Holt & Company, Macmillan Audio, Macmillan Children’s Publishing Group, The St. Martin's Publishing Group, and Tor Publishing Group. In the UK, Australia, India, and South Africa, companies in the Holtzbrinck Publishing Group publish under the Pan Macmillan name. The German publishing company, Holtzbrinck Deutsche Buchverlage, includes among its imprints S. Fischer, Kiepenheuer & Witsch, Rowohlt, and Droemer Knaur.

The successful candidate for this position will be an employee of Macmillan Publishing Group, LLC.

title: Closing Assistant Manager
description:
**Join Our Team: Closing Assistant Manager Position Open at Village Super Market, Inc.**

Are you a natural leader with a passion for retail? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy ensuring everything runs smoothly and efficiently? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are seeking an experienced and dedicated Closing Store Manager to oversee the successful end-of-day operations at our retail store. This full-time position offers a competitive salary, a flexible schedule, paid time off, and paid training. This full-time role requires availability for 10-hour shifts, including weekends and Monday to Friday.

As a Closing Store Manager, you will play a vital role in ensuring the seamless closing of our store each day. Your key responsibilities will include supervising staff, managing cash registers, securing the premises, and maintaining store cleanliness and organization. Your leadership will ensure our store is ready for success the next business day.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead and motivate a team of associates, providing coaching and feedback to enhance performance.
* Complete assigned tasks via task management systems promptly.
* Implement and uphold company standards across all departments.
* Ensure efficient store operations, meeting sales targets and customer service standards.
* Execute and enforce policies related to financial, inventory management, merchandising, safety, security, and compliance.
* Foster a safety culture for all customers and associates.
* Secure the store by locking doors, activating security systems, and conducting a final walkthrough.
* Conduct quick inventory checks and maintain product organization.
* Oversee store cleanliness, ensuring displays and common areas are tidy.
* Address last-minute customer inquiries and ensure all employees complete their tasks before clocking out.
* Provide a nightly report to the store manager or owner and report any maintenance or safety issues.

**Experience and Skills Required:**

* Minimum of 2-3 years' experience in a managerial role within the retail industry.
* Proven track record of effective staff management and operational efficiency.
* Familiarity with inventory management and compliance with health and safety regulations.
* Strong leadership, organizational, and multitasking skills.
* Proficient problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
* Prior experience in grocery retail is preferred.
* Flexibility to work weekends and holidays as needed.
* Customer-focused with a commitment to providing a positive shopping experience.

If you are ready to take your retail career to the next level and contribute to our store's success, apply now to become our Closing Store Manager. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

**Apply today to join the Village Super Market family and make a meaningful impact in the communities we serve.**

title: Vice President, Content
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is a full-service media agency with capabilities and expertise across all channels and disciplines. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the #1 media buying network in the Americas and #2 globally. As “The ROI Agency,” Zenith’s expertise lies in driving real, tangible business outcomes, not just media metrics, that will have a measurable effect on our clients’ business. Every investment we make has an ROI mindset—not just for our clients, but for our agency at large. We’re focused on driving the maximum value for our people, our capabilities and our media investments for some of the world’s leading brands.

 **Job Description** **Content Leadership:**

* Develop data-led innovation & content strategies across assigned client(s), leading to ownable consumer engagement opportunities across the media landscape.
* Embody both creative story-telling and thought leadership capabilities with analytical and technical knowledge and skill to perform at a high level. Has a strong command of the overall content landscape from a brand communication and publisher perspective.
* Lead the way in scouting & nurturing new ways to innovate for our client through nontraditional media places & spaces, with a focus on bringing forward ‘what’s next’.
* Support the total content & influencer practice across the organization, inclusive of thought leadership, sharing of learnings, staff development & mentorship, and innovation efforts.
* Collaborate with media partners, IP holders, and/or talent to identify, create, customize and execute opportunities that deliver on specific client goals across channels.
* Build and maintain strong relationship with media partners to enable mutually successful negotiation outcomes, access to innovations, and white-glove campaign execution.
* Lead project execution, campaigns, integrated sponsorships and content creation across linear, digital, streaming, social, print, event, interactive, and innovation platforms.
* Supervise the development, and monitoring of custom content & innovation executions, assuring quality control across implementation while mapping back to strategic intent.
* Facilitate collaboration with internal, publisher and client measurement leads to establish and report on program KPIs and drive optimization efforts
* Collaborate with Strategy, Investment, Search and Analytics teams to create integrated marketing solutions driving measurable ROI. Extend collaboration with other departments or disciplines to create opportunity and drive growth.
* Participate in new business pitches as Content/Innovation lead when required

 **Client Management:**

* Serve as client contact for all content and creative, regularly presenting recommendations and results to clients via formal & informal channels
* Build strong relationship with client team leads, continuously showcasing Zenith’s content strengths, thought leadership, innovation capabilities, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities

 **Team Leadership and Development:**

* Lead a team of Directors, Managers and Associates. Support, direct, mentor team to ensure individual, team, and client success.
* Embraces and encourages a culture based on cross team work, communication, collaboration, and innovative curiosity
* Brings content knowledge and supports trainings for all members of the team.
* Motivates, leads, and manages internal teams (Strategy, Biddable, Video, Search and Analytics teams), working collaboratively to plan, execute and optimize campaigns that meet objectives
* Assists in interviewing, hiring, training, mentoring, developing, and evaluating team members; conducts performance reviews for direct reports, helping them to further grow in their career
* Support greater Zenith Content practice as well as Publicis Media Content & Innovation practice by attending all meetings, trainings, etc.

  

**Qualifications**  

* B.A. or B.S. in Marketing, Advertising or related field
* 8-10 years of content, creative, marketing experience
* Knowledge and understanding of the production process for all mediums, including what it takes to deliver first-to-market
* Solid relationships with marketing, creative and production teams at marketplace partners as well an independent third parties
* Knowledge of social listening tools to aid in content strategy development (Netbase, Google trends, GWI, etc…)
* Must have excellent verbal/written communication skills, interpersonal skills, detail-orientation, follow-though skills
* Must be hard-working, resourceful and thrive in a fast-paced environment

  

**Additional Information** *Compensation Range: $153,000 - $185,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 11/05/2024.*


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Dental Assistant
description:
#### **Dental Assistant**



Are you passionate about making people smile? Join Diamond Braces as a **Dental Assistant!** Enjoy growth opportunities, great benefits, and a supportive team that's all about creating world-class smiles. Ready to make smiles your business? We’d love to meet you!


#### **Why Diamond Braces?**



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll have a clear path to success, with the support and resources you need to reach your professional goals while making a meaningful impact on our clients’ lives.


#### **What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary based on licensure and experience
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Discounted orthodontic care for you and your family
* Loan assistance for dental assistant school and continuing education (CE)
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Convenient office locations

#### **Essential Functions:**


* Assist with Dental and Ortho Procedures: Provide chairside assistance during dental treatments, ensuring the dentist has the necessary tools and support to deliver quality care.
* Prepare Treatment Rooms: Set up and sterilize instruments and equipment, ensuring a clean and safe environment for all dental procedures.
* Take Dental X-rays: Capture high-quality dental images as needed, following safety protocols to protect patients and staff.
* Educate Clients on Oral Health: Help clients understand the importance of maintaining good oral hygiene and provide instructions on post-treatment care.
* Manage Dental Records: Accurately maintain and update patient records, ensuring all information is correctly documented.
* Ensure Infection Control: Follow strict sterilization and disinfection procedures to prevent cross-contamination and protect patient health.
* Support the Dental Team: Assist with various tasks as needed to ensure the smooth operation of the practice.
* Maintain a Clean Workspace: Keep your work area clean and organized, upholding the highest standards of safety and hygiene.
* Stay Flexible: Be ready to handle additional tasks as required, adapting to the changing needs of the practice.

#### **Preferred Qualifications:**


* Relevant dental assistant licensure (if required by state law).
* Experience in a dental or healthcare setting.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in dental software and technology.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

#### **Who We Are:**



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service—the **'AAA Experience.'** We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


#### **Additional Information:**


* This position is full-time, and local travel between offices may be required.
* Salary is based on licensure, experience, skills, and qualifications.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and help our clients achieve the smile of their dreams, **apply today!**

#### **Licenses & Certifications**


Preferred* CPR Certificate
* RDA License

title: Mechanical Spares Technician
description:
**Date:** Sep 6, 2024


**Location:** Congers, NY, US, 10920


**Company:** Aptar Group
 

**Mechanical Spares Technician**  

 **Technical Operations**
**Create, Innovate, Deliver Solutions!** Aptar Pharma NA is seeking a **Spares Technician** within our Technical Operations team that supports, maintains and troubleshoots manufacturing equipment. Aptar Pharma is part of Aptar Group, a global leader with decades of success in the development of health dispensing solutions. Aptar Pharma has been setting the standard for drug delivery medical devices and we continue to break new ground providing innovative devices, components and services that enable the success of our clients and improve the health of patients. If you are curious, enjoy challenges and a fast-paced environment, we are the next step in your career! **Be Aptar!**  

As **Spares Technician,** you will beresponsible for organizing and maintaining the spare parts inventory and inventory system. The position is critical to the effective operation of our manufacturing and technical process teams to maintain equipment, manufacture product and meet all customer requirements.  

  

**What You Will Do at Aptar Pharma!**
* Determine levels of stock to keep on hand. Locate new and better local suppliers for current and future needs and assist with ordering parts and hardware Control the reception of all parts and verify their conformance to the original request.
* Provide administrative and logistics support for system maintenance and parts procurement
* Manage the SAP MIGO process.
* Communicate with suppliers to receive quotes and secure alternative suppliers if parts are no longer available.
* Maintain records and proper tracking of all orders, quotes, and pending requests.
* Identify spare parts no longer in use or available and report to management.
* Identify needed parts by auditing machinery on a regular basis.
* Educate staff in the proper use of the spare parts management system.
* Help improve the spare parts management system on a continuous basis.
* Create flags and other means of identifying potential issues in the use of parts.
* Identify excessive use of parts and report to management.
* Maintain a safe and clean work environment by complying with company procedures and report any dangerous situations or malfunction of equipment to management.
* Attend maintenance meetings.
* Additional Duties as may be assigned in support of the Technical Operations team
  
  

**What Aptar Pharma is Looking For!**
* High school degree with technical experience.
* At least one year of experience in Spare parts inventory experience, parts coordination in a manufacturing company
* At least 3 years’ experience working in a manufacturing environment.
* Ability to analyze spare parts to compile relevant reports
* Knowledge and use of working with Excel and/or database experience Knowledge and skill. Familiar with MS Office Suite.
* Ability to read and interpret mechanical prints.
* Collaborative, works well on teams and in interacting with other departments.
* General knowledge of various manufacturing techniques.
* Experience using of precision measuring equipment.
* Have knowledge of automation equipment, hardware, and spare parts BOMs Strong computer skills to help support automation spares and maintenance software databases
* Physically capable of the required work including but not limited to: Extensive use of manual dexterity, ability to grip, firmly hold, turn and practice strong hand coordination in order to troubleshoot, service and repair industrial equipment and use hand tools to perform the same. Ability to regularly stand, walk, lift, reach and bend while performing of essential job duties.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.
* Understands and practices safe working procedures. Observes safety rules and policies; brings to managements’ attention any unsafe acts or conditions
* Auditing or compliance experience helpful

  


**What We Offer**  

* An exciting, diverse and value based working environment
* Award-winning corporate university offering personal development and training opportunities.
* Competitive base salary
* Contribute to the communities where we reside.
* Innovative benefits plan which includes: 401k plan with Company matching benefit, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, life, disability and more
  

**Compensation and Base Annual Pay**
Aptar Pharma offers a competitive total rewards package including base salary or base hourly rate determined by many factors including the role, experience, knowledge, skill set and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. The typical hourly base rate range for the position this position to the specific work location of: New York City metropolitan region is USD $27.00 to $32 per hour. Additional details about total compensation and benefits are provided during the hiring process.  

**BE YOU, BE APTAR!**
*Aptar is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We believe that a diverse workforce is key to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information*

title: Patient Recruitment and Community Liaison Specialist
description:
About MedCare:

MedCare, LLC provides exceptional healthcare services to our Clinton Hill & Bedford–Stuyvesant community. We believe in fostering a supportive and inclusive environment for both our patients and staff. Join us in making a difference in the lives of our patients and contributing to the overall health and well-being of our community.

MedCare maintains a strong focus on compliance with healthcare regulations, including HIPAA. This ensures that both employees and patients are protected and that the company operates with integrity.

Job Title: Patient Recruitment and Community Liaison Specialist

Job Summary:

MedCare is seeking a highly motivated and organized Patient Recruitment and Community Liaison Specialist to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in recruiting new patients, assisting with scheduling appointments, acting as a liaison between patients and medical providers, and engaging with the local community as a representative of the company. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of HIPAA privacy laws and a passion for creating positive patient experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

* Patient Recruitment: Research and source potential patients through various channels, including community organizations, professional networks, social media, and community events.
* Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong relationships with new patients to ensure a seamless onboarding process.
* Strategic Planning: Design and implement effective recruitment strategies by researching the patient population, creating outreach plans, and continually improving campaign strategies.
* Metrics Monitoring: Monitor and track recruitment metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment processes and make necessary adjustments.
* Compliance: Ensure strict compliance with HIPAA patient privacy laws and maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant regulations.
* Process Management: Utilize tools to manage the recruitment process and track patient interactions efficiently.
* Lead Generation: Generate leads and manage the lead pipeline to ensure timely and effective patient recruitment.
* Collaboration: Work closely with other departments to enhance recruitment processes and increase overall patient satisfaction.

Qualifications:

* Proven experience in recruitment, sales, or customer relationship management (CRM).
* Strong understanding of HIPAA healthcare laws and relevant regulations.
* Familiarity with various insurance plans.
* Experience with Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience with training and development processes.
* Proficiency in interviewing and assessment processes.
* Demonstrated experience in patient recruiting and lead generation.

Salary and bonus structure can exceed $100,00

title: LLM Integration Specialist
description:
Job Title: GEN AI Software Engineer

Work location: Ridgefield Park, NJ

Duration: 1 year

* We're seeking a skilled engineer to lead the development of cutting-edge RAG applications using state-of-the-art LLM technologies.
* The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AI and NLP, with hands-on experience in building and optimizing LLM-based systems.
* This role requires expertise in integrating LLM solutions via APIs with both third-party tools and in-house applications.
* Experience with AWS Bedrock is highly valued, and familiarity with microservices architecture in cloud environments is a significant plus

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems
* Integrate and optimize Large Language Models (LLMs) via APIs
* Develop efficient information retrieval and extraction systems
* Build and manage databases and vector stores
* Apply Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques
* Monitor performance and continuously improve systems
* Integrate LLM solutions with other third-party tools and in-house applications
* Design and implement APIs for seamless integration of LLM capabilities

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field (Master's preferred)
* Proficiency in Python programming
* Deep understanding of LLMs, RAG systems, and API integration
* Experience with NLP and machine learning
* Strong skills in database and API development
* Knowledge of distributed systems and cloud computing
* Expertise in integrating AI models with various software solutions

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Contributions to open-source LLM projects
* Experience building AI systems in large-scale production environments
* Experience with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Faiss)
