title: Medical Scribe
description:
A Medical Scribe is responsible for relieving a physician of their clerical duties, thereby allowing a physician to focus their attention on providing the best care to the patient. They are responsible for locating and obtaining a patient's medical history, documenting dictated notes during a patient visit on the Electronic Medical Record (EMR), facilitating diagnostic test, all while providing unparalleled customer service to our patients.

**\\*This is a great opportunity for those interested in CNA, MA, EMT, or Paramedic careers**  
**\\* Great exposure to the healthcare profession (excellent resume builder for medical school or PA school)**

**Essential Functions/Responsibilities**

* Ability to maintain quick pace in fast paced urgent care facility for duration of scheduled shift (8-12 hours except for meals/break time)
* Facilitating any necessary diagnostic tests (e.g., CT, MRI, ultrasounds, etc.) and referrals to medical specialists for follow-up care via Aftercare
* Providing compassionate care to our patients
* Assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures set-ups
* Communicating with patients, pharmacies, and physicians over the phone under physician guidance
* Helping maintain a clean, courteous, and professional working environment
* Assist with training and acclimation of new hire scribes

**Qualifications**

* A High School Degree or GED
* Friendly and professional with excellent bedside manner
* Computer and typing skills are required - minimum of 45 wpm
* Flexible with full-time work schedule including weekends
* Passion for helping others in an urgent care environment
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
* High attention to detail and being able to work in a team environment
* Experience in any service industry a plus
* Must exhibit passion for outstanding results and compassion for those we work with and serve
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

**Physical Requirements**  
The job may require at times to lift light to moderate amounts of weight (e.g., boxes of medical/facility supplies) to assist team members. Job also requires ability to maintain a quick pace in fast paced urgent care medical facility for duration of scheduled shift minus meal/break time. Heavy computer use required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $18.25 per hour

* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Division Controller
description:
**Company Description**  

SOCOTEC is a provider of niche consulting services within the architecture, engineering and construction industries focusing on high-performance buildings and specialty structures. Through an integrated, holistic approach, our professionals provide solutions for building envelope, energy efficiency, sustainability, code advisory and construction advisory projects.


SOCOTEC offers competitive salary and benefits, mentorship, training, and social activities.


SOCOTEC is proud to announce that it has been officially certified as a Great Place to Work by the renowned global authority on workplace culture, Great Place to Work®.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a collaborative, hands-on, results-oriented Division Controller to join our team. Reporting to the Division leader, the Controller is responsible for the day-to-day financial operations of the division. The position will oversee divisional P&L, project budgets, billing, accounts receivable and cash collections activity, lump sum/hourly process management, divisional profitability with the Divisional leader.


Responsibilities include:

* Oversee the day-to-day financial operations of the division in accordance with Corporate standards and policies
* Implement and oversee full accounting life cycle standards, ensuring accuracy of documentation, approvals and classification of expenditures including divisional expense reports in accordance with the Corporate policy.
* Implement and oversee the monthly end close process, including preparation and review of journal entries, account reconciliations, financial statements, and various financial analyses related to the divisional performance.
* Meet all Corporate timelines for submission of financial information monthly and on request.
* Implement standard project percent complete methodology across all divisional services.
* Ensure Revenue is properly recognized for both hourly and percent complete contracts.
* Maintain and follow Group level and Corporate documented systems of accounting / internal control policies and procedures
* Proactively identify and implement process improvements and internal controls, in partnership with Corporate for divisional needs
* Liaison with acquisition team members, divisional and senior leaders regarding accounting/finance matters specific to the division
* Partner with Corporate Accounting to support and conclude the annual financial audit
* Work with external tax professionals and government agencies on company filings, as required by Corporate Accounting
* Comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings, as directed by Corporate Accounting
* Identify divisional support needs for accounting\\finance activity, manager\\train and hire roles, as needed, with Divisional and Corporate level approvals
* Evaluate departmental performance and adjust daily operations when needed to ensure the department meets overall goals and objectives
* Complete ad hoc accounting and finance requests and special projects

  

**Qualifications**  

The Controller candidate should have a Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field, **with 10+ years of relevant experience.** Experience with percentage of completion revenue recognition, labor utilization and project accounting within a service industry is preferred. Experience with Deltek is a strong plus.

* Detail oriented, strong analytical skills and initiative
* Thorough understanding of accrual based accounting, cost accounting and GAAP
* Flexible, resourceful and self-motivated with the ability to manage multiple deliverables
* Effective collaborator with strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal)
* Ability to adhere to month-end close timelines
* Strong Excel skills including Pivot tables and vlookups

  

**Additional Information**  

SOCOTEC offers generous compensation packages including salary, benefits & bonus based upon relevant experience.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines


Salary Range: 135-155K


SOCOTEC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Front Office Supervisor
description:
**Job Description**

Directly supervises all front office personnel and ensures proper completion of all front office duties. Directs and coordinates the activities of the front desk, reservations, guest services, and telephone areas. Prepare monthly reports and budget for front office department.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Trains, cross –trains, and retrains all front office personnel.
* Participates in the selection of front office personnel.
* Schedules the front office staff.
* Supervises workload during shifts.
* Maintains working relationships and communicates with all departments.
* Verifies that accurate room status information is maintained and properly communicated.
* Resolves guest problems quickly, efficiently, and courteously.
* Ensure desk delivers outstanding guest service.
* Updates group information. Maintains, monitors, and prepares group requirements. Relays information to appropriate personnel.
* Reviews and updates Company Profiles/Direct Bills.
* Monitors and responds to all guest reviews and brings any guest issues and/or concerns to the attention of the GM and Front Office Manager on a daily basis.
* Enforces all cash-handling, check-cashing, and credit policies.
* Wears the proper uniform at all times and requires all front office employees to wear proper uniforms at all times.
* Upholds the hotel's commitment to hospitality.
* Maximize room revenue and occupancy by reviewing status daily. Analyze rate variance, monitor credit report and maintain close observation of daily house count.
* Monitor selling status of house daily, flash report, allowance etc.
* Monitor high balance guest(s) and take appropriate action.
* Ensure implementation of all hotel policies and house rules.
* Operate all aspects of front office computer system, including software maintenance, report generation and analysis, and simple configuration changes.
* Ensure logging and delivery of all messages, packages, and mail in a timely and professional manner.
* Ensure that employees are, at all times, attentive, friendly, helpful and courteous to all guests, managers and other employees.
* Monitor all V.I.P 's special guests and requests.
* Maintain required pars of all front office and stationary supplies.
* Review daily front office work and activity reports generated by Night Audit.
* Review Front office log book and Guest feedback forms on a daily basis.
* Maintain an organized and comprehensive filing system with documentation of purchases, vouchering, schedules, forecasts, reports and tracking logs.
* Coordinate with housekeeping, maintenance, and sales manager.
* As a working Supervisor, you will be expected to cover shifts as needed based on occupancy and labor budget. In addition, you will be responsible for coverage of call off, or to coordinate with staff for coverage.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent.
* 2-3 years of working in a hotel experience -- ***must be on resume to be considered.*** .
* Opera PMS system experience (*preferred*).
* 1 - 2 years of supervisory/managerial experience -- ***must be on resume to be considered.***

***Radisson JFK Airport*** *isan Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability or veteran status.*

title: Treatment Coordinator
description:
#### **Treatment Coordinator**



Are you passionate about making people smile? Join Diamond Braces as a **Treatment Coordinator!** Enjoy growth opportunities, great benefits, and a supportive team that's all about creating world-class smiles. Ready to make smiles your business? We’d love to meet you!


#### **Why Diamond Braces?**



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll have a clear path to success, with the support and resources you need to reach your professional goals while making a meaningful impact on our clients’ lives.


#### **What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary + performance-based bonuses
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Discounted orthodontic care for you and your family
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Convenient office locations

#### **Essential Functions:**


* Educate Clients on Healthy Smiles: Help clients understand why a healthy smile is important by clearly explaining the long-term benefits of dental care. Make the treatment process exciting and easy to grasp.
* Guide Through Treatment Choices: Support clients in making informed decisions by providing simple, clear explanations of their treatment options and the benefits they can expect.
* Answer Questions: Use strong communication skills to respond to client inquiries, whether in person, over the phone, or via email, ensuring they feel well-supported and informed.
* Manage Appointments Smoothly: Keep the schedule running efficiently by optimizing appointment times, reducing wait times, and maintaining a smooth client flow.
* Greet Clients Warmly: Welcome every client with a friendly attitude, creating a comfortable and positive environment from the moment they walk in.
* Provide Clear Information: Make sure clients have all the information and documents they need, showing transparency and commitment to their care.
* Verify Insurance Details: Confirm clients' insurance eligibility, usage, and limitations. Follow up with them on their benefits and coverage as needed.
* Support the Dental Team: Assist dentists and other team members as needed, ensuring the practice operates smoothly and efficiently.
* Maintain a Clean Workspace: Keep your work area clean and safe, helping to prevent the spread of infection and protect the well-being of clients and staff.
* Stay Flexible: Be ready to handle any additional tasks as needed, adapting to the changing needs of the practice.

#### **Preferred Qualifications:**


* Bilingual abilities are a plus.
* Experience in retail, sales, or a similar customer-focused role.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in computer literacy.
* Managerial experience is an advantage.
* Clear long-term career goals aligned with our company values.

#### **Who We Are:**



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service—**the 'AAA Experience.'** We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


#### **Additional Information:**


* This position is full-time, and local travel between offices may be required.
* Salary is based on experience, skills, and qualifications.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and help our clients achieve the smile of their dreams, **apply today!**

title: Experienced Veterinary Assistant
description:
**Join The VCA Nassau Suffolk Animal Hospital Team!**

VCA Nassau Suffolk is seeking an EXPERIENCED full-time Veterinary Assistant to join our 3-doctor, full-service hospital in Farmingdale, NY. We have served the community for over 30 years and we support and encourage each team member to grow professionally and personally. We have a unique culture in our hospital that values each person’s skills and personality. There’s something special about you and we are excited to learn more!

**Why Join the VCA Family?**

We are passionate about supporting our veterinary assistants and technicians and are committed to your continuing education and personal career development. At VCA Animal Hospitals, we are committed to equity, inclusion, and diversity and strive to be a place where a talented mix of people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We support a work environment where you can focus on your career, happiness, and the patients you serve.

*Some of the benefits we offer:*

* Access to the people and financial resources of a large veterinary community
* Growth & leadership opportunities
* Career development programs
* Veterinary Technology degree tuition support and scholarships
* Veterinary Technician license reimbursement
* Medical, dental & vision insurance
* Generous hospital discounts and product discounts
* Employer-paid life, long- and short-term disability insurance
* Paid vacation and sick time
* Paid parental leave
* 401(k)
* Free mental health resources and wellness subscriptions (Headspace)
* Referral bonuses
* Competitive wage
* Opportunities to give back through strong Shelter partnerships and VCA Charities

**Why We Want You**

As a member of the VCA team, you will help create and maintain a positive, low-stress atmosphere for our clients and patients. Your mission will be to win the confidence of every pet parent—by delivering an outstanding client experience—so we can provide exceptional care to every patient.

Whether you are a seasoned Veterinary Assistant or a Technician in training, we want you to use the knowledge that you’ve invested your time and talent in. The skills that will be utilized include, but are not limited to:

* Compassionate patient care
* Client education and care
* Pharmacy and medication administration
* Lab sample collection and processing
* Diagnostic imaging
* Surgical preparation and assisting
* Anesthesia monitoring
* Dentistry
* Medical recordkeeping

Ready to grow with a collaborative and supportive team? Apply now- We look forward to hearing from you!

At VCA we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion and want to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work.

VCA Nassau Suffolk Animal Hospital offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including Medical/Dental/Vision insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, pet care discounts, paid vacation, holidays and sick days, health and well-being programs that provide resources and training. Compensation is negotiable based on education, experience, and other relevant credentials.

The pay range for this position is $18 to $23 per hour.

* Every weekend

title: Cloud Operations Administrator
description:

This position will report to the Cloud Architect and be responsible for the deployment and integration of new solutions to our existing hyperscale and cloud platforms. Will work closely with Data Center Operations, End User computing, Network engineering and Desktop engineering teams to ensure consistency and quality delivery of their work.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Maintaining the Cloud team’s standard environments and services, server builds, upgrades, updates, certificates, etc.
* Implementing automation for as many of the above standard O&M responsibilities as possible and developing new efficiencies and improvements
* Serving as an interface to other infrastructure and development teams to move Cloud priorities forward.
* Building and maintaining tools to manage deployment activities.
* Providing support for custom tools as required
* Windows and Linux Operating system knowledge
* Managing COTS tools required to support the Cloud team.
* Manage compute capacity to identify under or over provisioned services and right size as appropriate.
* Manage and solution for AWS Trusted Advisor recommendations
* Ensuring exceptional documentation and communication of processes, procedures, and efficiencies

* Security and Compliance: Implement security protocols and ensure systems comply with industry standards while conducting routine security assessments.
* Troubleshooting and Support: Provide technical support and resolution for system issues, optimizing system performance.

title: HR Specialist - TAM Instructional and Payroll
description:
HR Specialist - TAM Instructional and Payroll


**POSITION DETAILS**


Reporting to the Deputy Director of Human Resources, the Human Resources Specialist will be responsible for ensuring the data integrity of all HR systems including CUNYfirst, payroll, time and leave, performance management, and personnel action tracking systems. In addition to the CUNY Title Overview duties, responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:


* Assist in full cycle recruitment processes including classification and compensation, auditing and reviewing postings, employment offers, preparing agendas for the Internal Vacancy Review Committee meetings, CUNYFirst talent acquisition management (TAM), and position management; including onboarding and offboarding of full-time staff.
* Works closely with Compliance and Diversity, Provost, Deans, Vice President and Department Heads to provide guidance on recruitment, classification, and compensation matters.
* Interviews and appoints candidates for classified staff vacancies during hiring pools and serve as a search committee member to expedite all classified and non-teaching searches.
* Assists the Deputy Director in the management and implementation of HR systems and administering human resources/payroll processes to ensure compliance with all collective bargaining agreements, and College rules and regulations.
* Maintains an in-depth knowledge of timekeeping and payroll rules and provides timely resolution/responses to all related employee issues/inquiries.
* Responsible for the daily audit reviews of CUNYFirst transaction reports, initiates applicable data corrections, and makes recommendations for process changes in accordance with changes in regulations.
* Supervises staff in payroll unit.
* Prepares and disseminates HR systems reports to managers and employees as necessary.
* Maintains and updates content for the HR website.
* Assists the Deputy Director and HR Manager with planning to provide better services to the College Community.
* Serves on various College committees and perform special projects and other duties as assigned.


Lehman College, of The City University of New York, ranks among the top five institutions in the nation for fostering social mobility. A four-year Hispanic-Serving Institution in the Bronx, Lehman offers bachelor’s, master’s, and advanced degrees and certificate programs in the Liberal Arts, sciences, and professions. The College’s community-driven mission and notable academic programs attract a diverse, international enrollment of over 15,000 students who take courses on its 37-acre, tree-lined campus and online degree programs. Many thousands more community members benefit yearly from its active cultural, educational, health, and economic outreach programs and services.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


Bachelor's Degree and four years' related experience required.


70% in person is required.


* Must have a proficient knowledge of Peoplesoft/Oracle and/or HRIS systems with computer skills
* Maintain current knowledge of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and affirmative action guidelines and laws such as the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
* Knowledge of business and management principles involve in strategic planning, resource allocation, and leadership technique
* Excellent written/verbal communication skills
* Maintain a high degree of confidentiality and discretion with regard to all matters, data, and documents
* Detailed oriented, self-directed, motivated and proactive
* Strong problem solving and critical thinking aptitude
* Experience in a public sector for human resources department
* Ability to work in a fast-pace environment


**CUNY TITLE OVERVIEW**


Develops and administers processes and policies regarding Human Resources.


* Advises employees and managers on Human Resources policies and guidelines; provides a high level of customer service in assisting members of the College community
* Supervises and administers one or more human resources programs such as recruiting, pay administration, employee orientation, employee benefits, data entry and recordkeeping, and performance appraisal/reappointment practices
* Maintains an in-depth understanding of CUNY rules and regulations, relevant laws and guidelines, collective bargaining agreements, and College policies, and applies these to his/her areas of responsibility
* Investigates regarding sensitive employee issues or complaints
* Helps create innovative communications such as manuals, web pages, or employee meetings and provides these to the College community
* Performs related duties as assigned.


Job Title Name: HR Specialist


**CUNY TITLE**


Higher Education Assistant


**FLSA**


Non-exempt


**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**


Salary commensurate with education and experience, $79,188-$82,928.


CUNY's benefits contribute significantly to total compensation, supporting health and wellness, financial well-being, and professional development. We offer a range of health plans, competitive retirement/pension benefits and savings plans, tuition waivers for CUNY graduate study and generous paid time off. Our staff also benefits from the extensive academic, arts, and athletic programs on our campuses and the opportunity to participate in a lively, diverse academic community in one of the greatest cities in the world.


**HOW TO APPLY**


Visit www.cuny.edu, access the employment page, log in or create a new user account, and search for this vacancy using the Job ID or Title. Select "Apply Now" and provide the requested information.


Candidates must attach a resume, cover letter, and three professional references (name, title, organization, and contact information).

title: DSCR Loan Officer
description:
Role Description

This is a full-time, remote role for a DSCR Loan Officer. We believe in building freedom, purpose, and fulfilment in the lives of our clients and in our own lives as well. The DSCR Mortgage Broker will be responsible for providing real estate mortgage debt options to clients that improve the clients life and enhances their portfolio. The role involves mortgage marketing, sales, and providing finance advice to clients.

Company Description

Aurum and Sharpe Commercial Mortgage is a full-service commercial mortgage brokerage founded by two seasoned mortgage bankers who met at JP Morgan Chase. With over 19 years of experience in mortgage finance, our team provides timely, well-researched, and actionable insights on investment real estate financing. We specialize in Debt Service Coverage Ratio Business Purpose (DSCR) Mortgages on 1-4 unit properties primarily in FL, MD, PA, OH, SC, TX, DC, IL, CO, KY, DE, GA, LA, MA, and NH.

Qualifications

* Good character, integrity
* Cold calling experience
* Sales experience
* **Can self source customers**
* Mortgage Broker and Finance skills
* Debt Consolidation and Mortgage Marketing skills
* Brokerage knowledge and experience
* Strong analytical and negotiation skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and remotely
* Previous experience in real estate or mortgage industry
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Liberal Arts, Sciences, Finance, Business, or related field
* Owner of rental real estate preferred

**Why Should You Apply?**

* **Once you close your first self sourced loan with us, we provide you with qualified leads from our advertising**
* **We have a number of lenders that we work with that we know can close**
* **You will have a processor for every one of your loans after you close your first self sourced loan**
* **Our title team will clear title for you**
* **You will earn 50% of all loan revenue**
* **You will be paid on a 1099 so you can manage your own taxes**
* **On track earnings (closing a minimum of 3 loans per month)- $108,000**

Other Considerations

* We do not provide a salary or draw. This job is 100% commission on a 1099.
* This job is completely remote and you can originate in the above states
* You are required to source your own leads

We Want You Here If:

* You have a strong desire to leave your mark on this world before you go
* You have proven that you would make sacrifices for the well-being those in your care
* You already know how to be self-sufficient
* You know how to work both smart and hard

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $108,000.00 - $240,000.00 per year

* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Analyst, Paralegal
description:
**About General Atlantic**



General Atlantic is a leading global growth investor with more than four decades of experience providing capital and strategic support for over 520 growth companies throughout its history. Established in 1980 to partner with visionary entrepreneurs and deliver lasting impact, the firm combines a collaborative global approach, sector-specific expertise, a long-term investment horizon, and a deep understanding of growth drivers to partner with great entrepreneurs and management teams to scale innovative businesses around the world. General Atlantic has approximately $83 billion in assets under management inclusive of all products as of June 30, 2024, and more than 300 investment professionals based in New York, Amsterdam, Beijing, Hong Kong, Jakarta, London, Mexico City, Miami, Mumbai, Munich, San Francisco, São Paulo, Shanghai, Singapore, Stamford and Tel Aviv. For more information on General Atlantic, please visit: www.generalatlantic.com.


Position Summary



General Atlantic is looking to hire a corporate paralegal to join the Legal and Compliance Department in our New York office. The paralegal will join an established team and will assist in all stages of transactions and with the preparation and organization of documents necessary for our global business activities. The role includes basic paralegal duties but also includes assistance with corporate minute books, coordination of transactional documents, formation and dissolution of domestic and international entities, significant document management and organization, response to annual questionnaires and certifications for the firm’s portfolio companies, global regulatory and anti-trust filings and Anti-Money Laundering and Know-Your-Customer reviews. This individual will perform a variety of basic and increasingly complex work under the supervision of attorneys and with the guidance of supervisory or senior paralegals.



Responsibilities



* Document Management
* Formation and Dissolution of Entities
* Directors & Officers Questionnaires
* Regulatory & Anti-Trust Filings
* Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know-Your-Customer (KYC) Requests
* Monitoring and responding to various legal information requests
* Coordination of signatures, including e-signatures via DocuSign


Qualifications


* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college
* 1-3 years of corporate legal experience, either at a law firm or in financial services
* Familiarity with formation of various types of legal entities in global jurisdictions (Delaware, Bermuda and Luxembourg a plus), including filing certificates of incorporation/formation, referencing bylaws/operating agreements, and applications of authority
* Experience maintaining corporate minute books and records, coordinating transactional documents with great attention to detail
* Highly analytical with strong intuition; able to think and react quickly
* Strong project management skills – time management, pattern recognition, prioritization, and strong judgement are critical; ability to work well under pressure without compromising quality
* Exceptional follow through, reliability, and desire to consistently deliver results
* Resourceful with the ability to work independently and proactively in a high performing global organization.
* Highly collaborative with excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and capable of working effectively cross functionally
* Demonstrated maturity and professional presence; comfortable interacting with senior executives
* Highly motivated, inquisitive, an active listener, and quick learner with a positive can-do attitude
* Team player excited to grow within an expanding legal department, learn the “why,” and develop institutional knowledge
* Proficiency in Adobe and PowerPoint as well as basic Excel and Outlook familiarity


General Atlantic offers a robust reward program to all employees that will support you and your family, maintaining fulfilling, secure and healthy lives now and into the future, which includes but is not limited to medical insurance, retirement savings contributions, mental and physical health resources and an equal pay program that allows you to earn a base salary of $75,000-$97,500 USD of which the exact amount offered will be driven by the degree to which you meet role requirements, additional special skills and experience. Additional reward programs, such as annual discretionary bonuses and long-term incentive programs, are available for eligible employees and are offered as recognition for performance and one’s contributions towards the organization’s success.


General Atlantic is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.



By completing this application, you are consenting to General Atlantic’s processing and use of your personal data. Information on how General Atlantic will use and process your data can be found here: https://www.generalatlantic.com/privacy-policy/

title: Seasonal Sales Associate
description:
**Seasonal Sales Associate**Location
**Jersey Gardens**City
**Elizabeth**State/Territory
**NJ**
  
**JOB TITLE: Seasonal Sales Associate**

  

**IMMEDIATE MANAGER: Store Manager**



**JOB CLASSIFICATION: Non - Exempt**

  


**THE PURPOSE**



As a **Seasonal Sales Associate**, you will maintain outstanding customer service as per company standards, achieve individual sales goals, drive team collaboration, maintain True Religion merchandising standards, and safeguard company assets.

  


**THE ROLE**


* Greet and acknowledge every customer, maintaining solid product knowledge and all other aspects of customer service.
* Maintain an awareness of all promotions and advertisements.
* Assist in floor moves, merchandising, display maintenance, and housekeeping
* Assist in processing and replenishing merchandise and monitoring floor stock.
* Assist in completing price changes within the department.
* Operate a computerized point-of-sale cash register and inventory management system: including the accurate entry of sales information: receiving payment for products: processing credit card transactions; making correct changes; processing refunds, exchanges, and voids; and issuing gift certificates and credit slips.
* Reconcile daily sales and prepare deposits and end-of-day reports for management.
* Utilize a working knowledge of all retail merchandise including price, any special product considerations, and stock location in-store and in the back stockroom.
* Accurately perform all merchandise receipt processing, including processing in the POS system; merchandise inspection, tagging, stocking, and display. Communicate all damages and wrong shipments to store management.
* Actively maintain the store appearance including keeping merchandise neatly organized and attractively displayed. Dust and clean shelves regularly, fold t-shirts, and arrange merchandise to maintain the highest level of visual presentation.

  


**YOU ARE**


* Retail Savvy: you understand the complexities that come with working in a luxury retail environment and its customers
* Goal Oriented: you work hard and strategize in order to achieve daily, monthly, and yearly sales goals.
* Upbeat: you always have a positive and welcoming attitude towards peers and customers.
* Brand Knowledgeable: you know our brand like the back of your hand including all fits and styles.
* Fashionable: you are current with trends and are able to make styling recommendations to the customer.
* ***Fearless, Focused, Open and Fast!***
  


**REQUIRED MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**


* High School Diploma
* Must be over 18 years of age
* Minimum of 6 months of retail sales experience
* Ability to read, count, and write to accurately complete all documentation
* Ability to operate all equipment necessary to perform the job, including but not limited to standing, stooping, lifting 11 kilograms, and climbing a ladder


*Company Order Number: 11520*  

*Number of Openings: 10*



Applicable law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process. Please let us know if you require accommodation, and we will make appropriate arrangements.



In order to evaluate your candidacy, we may ask you to provide us with certain personal information, including your identification data (e.g. name, date of birth, driver’s license number, social security number, passport number, and contact details), education information, financial information (for payroll and benefits), and professional and employment history.

title: LITIGATION DEFENSE TRIAL ATTORNEY
description:
**LITIGATION DEFENSE TRIAL ATTORNEY**

**Flanagan, Barone & O’Brien, LLC** (“FBO”) is a successful, growing firm which embraces diversity in seeking to build a strong team of professionals. FBO is currently seeking a Litigation Defense Attorney with 7+ years of trial experience. The position provides a flexible schedule and the opportunity to work both independently and as part of our strong litigation team.

**Responsibilities:**

* Handle all aspects of insurance defense matters (auto, general liability, construction, products liability and property damage matters) up to and through trial, including discovery, court appearances, depositions/examinations under oath, expert issues, and client management
* Communicate with clients, experts, witnesses to prepare for and complete trial testimony
* Drafting pleadings, briefs, motions, discovery, required client reports
* Render opinions on liability, damages and case value
* Appear before courts and arbitrators/mediators

**Qualifications:**

* JD from an accredited law school
* Admitted to NJ Bar
* Must have completed at least five (5) civil trials
* 7+ years previous experience in litigation with trial experience
* Experience with insurance defense, general liability and construction litigation
* Ability to integrate into a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Exceptional writing and communication skills
* Computer proficiency
* Ability to maintain/enter billable time
* Ability to prioritize assignments and case load with trial schedule
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Candidate must have a flexible schedule and demonstrate a commitment to providing quality client service and adherence to work completion deadlines.

Candidate must be a member in good standing with the New Jersey Bar and be able to travel as required for trials, hearings, depositions, etc.

FBO offers a comprehensive benefits package and is an equal opportunity employer. Salary is competitive and commensurate with experience.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

title: Night Area Manager (Janitorial)
description:
**Night Area Manager– QBS**

The position requires the following, non-negotiable characteristics:

· Precision and accuracy in the performance of all duties.

· Direct, articulate and succinct communication style, both verbal and written.

· Mastery of organizational skills, including management of multiple tasks and deadlines.

· Analysis of issues with a methodical and efficient, yet thorough, approach.

· Self-motivation to be proactive in identifying problems and developing recommended solutions.

· Self-discipline to always conduct oneself with the utmost professionalism, integrity, reliability and accountability.

The Night Area Manager has multiple responsibilities for managing operations during evening and overnight hours.

The Night Area Manager should be fully aware of supervisor job descriptions and forms used by supervisors.

**Essential Functions:**

· Communicate with operations support team and day area manager team.

· Go over all schedules and coverages for assigned locations.

· Communicate with building supervisors regarding all coverages and activities.

· Review calendar to confirm delivery of supplies for all assigned locations.

· Meet with HR to go over disciplines, suspensions, warnings and other personnel issues for assigned buildings.

· Choose a building (different location each day) for the beginning of the shift. Perform safety training and ensure each supervisor is following QBS processes and expectations.

· Ensure all WO and payroll is updated by each supervisor

· Night Area Manager is required to attend the inspection unless there is an emergency or important project which prohibits attendance.

· All customer complaints received, whether about the performance of the Night Area Manager or the staff/supervisors at assigned locations, must be communicated

· Supervise Supplies Orders with Operations

**Experience/Education:**

· Experience with vendor/tenant relations

* Must be knowledgeable in technical skills regarding cleaning methods, procedures and products such as floor care, carpet care (shampoo – scotch guard application etc.), green products compliant.
* Must meet deadlines, effectively communicate with Management, follow and implement company procedures and policies with little supervision
* Must be professional and have excellent customer service skills
* Demonstrate QBS culture, be hard working, and be flexible to adapt and adjust to certain situations (commitment, honesty, integrity, and transparency to name a few).
* Meticulous attention to detail is a must
* Must be driven, energetic, "hit the ground running", and have the willingness and desire to grow with QBS!

QBS maintains operations 24/7/365 and is an “essential business” in the New York area. We work during normal times as well as when other businesses may be closed down. The position requires flexibility and an ability to work whatever schedule and hours are deemed necessary to efficiently accomplish the work and service our clients, which may include working extended hours, weekends, holidays, and/or during emergency situations, such as natural disasters (storms, including but not limited to rain, wind, snow and ice, floods, power outages, fires, earthquakes, etc.), public health emergencies such as the COVID-19 pandemic, government-declared states of emergency, labor strikes, and force majeure events. Accessibility to answer questions by email or phone during off hours in accordance with QBS’ policies is expected. The ability to work this schedule is an essential function of the job.

*Quality Building/Protection Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: RBT Tech
description:
Apex ABA is an Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) treatment provider dedicated to providing the best quality care for our clients. At Apex, we combine our values and clinical expertise to provide collaborative, compassionate care in order to promote the best outcomes for our learners. We believe that it is essential for the services we provide to progress alongside the ever-evolving field of ABA. As an RBT Level 1 you will work directly with clients delivering high quality, intensive, ABA interventions under supervision of the Behavior Analysts (BCBA) who develop each client’s treatment plan. Our goal is to focus on high quality, ethical, individualized treatment. We believe in authenticity and create a place where everyone can show up as their true selves. Teamwork is of the essence and we all commit to working closely together to support each other and the clients we serve. We encourage professional growth and offer career development opportunities to all of our staff.

Responsibilities:

* Deliver 1:1 direct ABA treatment in accordance to goals & targets set by the BCBA
* Work closely with the supervising BCBA to ensure high quality service delivery
* Collect data and document client records to monitor progress and to enable the best possible treatment decisions
* Communicate regularly with parents, supervisor(s), and others as necessary to inform and improve treatment plans
* Provide services to clients in home, school or other location(s) as agreed and necessary
* Schedule may include driving between clients
* Exhibit professionalism and reliability in attending scheduled sessions.

Benefits:

* Competitive Compensation
* Opportunities for career growth.
* Paid RBT Training
* Supportive supervisors & mentors
* Ideal for candidates pursuing BCBA certification or training in Applied Behavior Analysis.

Qualifications:

* High School diploma required
* Certification as Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) highly preferred
* At least 1-2 years experience working with children highly preferred
* At least 1 year experience with ABA preferred
* Bachelor’s Degree in psychology or related field preferred
* Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
* Should enjoy working on an interdisciplinary team and collaborating with others
* Detail oriented with strong organizational skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Passion for helping others

Apex is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
**Who we are:**

We are a group of dedicated individuals whose goal is to provide care that is tailored to meet the specific needs of first responders, educators, county, municipal, and administrative workers. Through the Save My Life Program, frontline workers receive comprehensive and extensive testing so they can be at their healthiest when they are serving our communities. By using our program, essential workers and their families can have peace of mind by limiting the occupational risks in their essential positions.

**Job Summary:** 

The Echo Sonographer independently performs professional level assessments and a variety of non-invasive studies using ultrasound and related diagnostic technology as appropriate and records the results and clinical preliminary impressions as indicated. The results of these exams are used to direct the course of patient care. This position is an Echo Sonographer with knowledge of Echo anatomy, physiology, and pathology. The sonographer will participate in daily maintenance and care of equipment. All examinations are performed within standard protocols on adults. The sonographer performs examinations in the clinic using portable or stationary equipment. The sonographer communicates preliminary impressions of examination results to referring physicians within Medical Essential Diagnostics and other 3rd party groups. There is daily contact with professionals and families. The sonographer must solve problems related to the daily needs of patients, the department and/or clinic with professional standards on documentation of care and timeliness.

**Essential Functions (Duties/Responsibilities)** 

* Perform ultrasound scans on 8 or more patients per day
* Collaborate and communicate with provider and clinic staff to ensure smooth flow within clinic operations.
* Operate ultrasound equipment utilizing a variety of techniques.
* Adjust equipment/machine settings to obtain optimal diagnostic results.
* Perform examinations, recognizing the significance of all structures that are visualized, differentiating artifacts from appropriate images, while recognizing the limitations of equipment and utilizing knowledge of anatomy and physiology.
* Educate patients and families of safe and appropriate testing; thoroughly explaining procedures, answering questions and calming concerns.
* Make knowledgeable clinical assessments and judgments.

**Knowledge Skills and Abilities:**

* Ability to maintain composure under stress, using tact and good judgment.
* Demonstrate analytical decision-making skills; ability to quickly assess and resolve technical and patient care problems.
* Ability to work both independently and as a care team member.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality of medical records
* Ability to prioritize tasks.
* Ability to interact professionally and develop effective relationships.
* Ability to comply with all HIPAA requirements.
* Basic computer skills (ability to navigate the computer, Internet and keyboarding skills).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

**Education/ Experience:**

* At least 1 year of experience in Echo Ultrasounds
* RDCS/RCS Certification, ARRT Certification, ARDMS/RDMS Certification
* Appropriate schooling and clinical experience

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to exert up to 50 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 20 lbs. of force frequently, and/or up to 10 lbs. of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body).
* Good manual dexterity is important for tasks such as typing, using a mouse, and handling paperwork.

title: Customer Service Retail Officer
description:
**Job description**

**WHO WE ARE:**

Servexo provides fully integrated security solutions utilizing highly trained staff, leading-edge technology, and the latest equipment. While our team can execute protective services in a variety of situations, we specialize in the corporate, government, health care, education, and utilities sectors. Our next generation approach combines traditional methods with hi-tech options such as cyber security, drone technology and biometrics.

Employing industry-leading software, our physical security uses a mobile-enabled tool throughout their patrol. With GPS monitoring, up-to-the-minute reporting, detailed analytics and much more, our clients experience the Servexo advantage in real-time. Customized, affordable security solutions our clients want without compromising the protection they need … that’s our client commitment.

**WHAT WE OFFER:**

Servexo offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage and 401k plan, . We also offer a referral program for everyone in the company.

**SECURITY JOB DESCRIPTION:**

Serve as a visible crime deterrent in assigned areas/ branches on foot or by mobile patrol to protect the site. Perform frequent and unpredictable patrols throughout the client location and property. Provide electronic documentation of all activities and or incidents via our guard force management application. Ensure areas are clear of trespassers, transient, or unauthorized persons. Prevent, report, and identify any damage, vandalism, graffiti, or unauthorized vehicles. Identify any suspicious activity, record activity in daily and incident reports. Provide security functions to include, but not limited to: observe, report, and notify local law enforcement authorities as needed.

**Security Responsibilties:**

· Observe and Report

· Respond to emergencies/ incidents, relieve guards for breaks, escorting staff/visitors. Keep vigilance over entry exit, transportation activity by foot.

· Assist in operation of elevators, fire system monitoring, alarm monitoring, CCTV review and/ or handle loading dock access for deliveries.

· Notify Law Enforcement of any unlawful activity

· Inspect vehicles as entering the property of the site.

· Conduct hourly reports on our Guard Tracking application

· Comply with supervisor directives while on duty

· Carry out other duties as assigned

**Security Officer Requirments:**

· Must Obtain a Security License

·Must be 21 years or older.

·Must have a Highschool Diploma

·Must be a US Citizen

· Must be able to navigate and patrol up and down stairs

*2 years Security, Law Enforcement, Active Military, Reserves, Or National Gaurd experience.*

· Must maintain a neat, clean, and well-groomed professional appearance while on duty in accordance with company and client standards

*Servexo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against based on disability.*

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
**Work Location:** Great Neck, NY 11021  
**Start date**: ASAP  
**Pay Range**: $85,000 - $105,000 per year (on-site) +10% annual MBO based on achieving mutually agreed upon objectives

* **3-4+ years experience**
* BS in Business nice but not necessary
* **Experience in food, chemical, ingredient industry with a manufacturing company**
* **4 days onsite**
* Possible stipend around $5,000 for relocation.

**Description**  
We are a global distributor and sourcing partner of chemicals and ingredients. We are an established player in the global specialty chemical markets, providing end-use manufacturers across industries in North America, LATAM, & EMEA with end-to-end supply chain solutions from across the globe. Our team has been operating for over 45 years, serving customers in over 25 countries, with 200+ professionals in 9 offices strategically located across 4 continents. Wego is family owned and operated, with 3 members of ownership across 2 generations actively serving in leadership as CEO, COO, and CCO.

**Job Summary**  
This position will work closely with marketing, product management, sales to drive growth in new and adjacent products. You will drive a variety of functions under the product management department, including **product development, supply chain, sales, and marketing**. This position will be responsible for **driving the levers of value including pricing, product proposition and differentiation, costing.** The workstreams will include product research, market analysis, global sourcing and purchasing, sales forecasting and inventory planning, cost and pricing analysis, and more. This position will interface directly with 3rd party manufacturers, customers, as well as our teams in sourcing, logistics, customer service, and sales.

We are looking for candidates who bring a **strong background in product management with skills in market and product research, data analysis, inventory management, and business development.** You will be responsible for maintaining a high level of internal operational efficiency and for delivering superior service to our customers – internally and externally.

**Responsibilities**

* Being the first point of contact for any product related inquiries
* Being the go-to person for product proposition, pricing, costing, profitability, sourcing etc.
* Communication to global sales force of supply chain checkpoints and hiccups
* Forecast, plan, and manage global inventory levels at a SKU-warehouse level to ensure customer needs are met and inventory risks are mitigated
* Identify, contact, and vet appropriate vendors for new product sourcing
* Conduct market research and identify competitive information and new client opportunities
* Partner with our sales reps, marketing and global product managers on identifying new business opportunities in our clients and prospects
* Developing go to market strategy for product line and implementing across all geographies
* Monitor and optimize cost and pricing through ongoing analysis of costs and market dynamics, and making recommendations to senior product managers and outside sales teams
* Coordinate with suppliers regarding order discrepancies, shipment shortages, and other transactional errors
* Contribute new ideas to leadership team that foster overall company success

**Key Qualifications**

* **Strong analytical skills and comfortable with forecasting over various time periods and identifying variances in data**
* Experience using **public data sources to identify global suppliers and study market trends**
* Ability to **effectively communicate and influence our internal and external stakeholders - suppliers, managers, and intra-company departments with both excellent written and verbal skills**
* **High energy, go-getter, proactive, and highly organized with an ability to manage and complete multiple tasks on time**

title: Personal Aide
description:
**Personal Aide Positions Available**

**Full-Time position**

Come make a difference with us!

Here at the Gramon Family of Schools we aspire to help students with special needs achieve success in areas related to independence, life skill development and academics. Drawing on the principles of applied behavioral analysis and the collaboration of professionals in all disciplines such as occupational and physical therapy, speech language services, counseling services, we strive to make an impact not only on our students’ educational goals but also on their lives beyond our classrooms.

Our teams are supportive, caring, and willing to go the extra mile to ensure success! Our working environment supports a culture that involves team building, mentoring, shared success, and fun!

**Personal Aide - Full-Time position**

The primary responsibilities of the **Personal Aide** is to work with other school personnel in developing and instituting a therapeutic and academic program to help students with functional skills and subject matter that will contribute to their development as mature, able and responsible individuals. Using professional expertise and supervisory and other resources provided, the Instructional Paraprofessional helps educate students in accordance with the goals, policies and curriculum adopted by the school and classroom teacher(s), and in accordance with the students’ IEP.

Regular School Year (September – June) staff hours Monday - Friday from 8:00 am - 3:30 pm.

Summer hours are from 8:30 am– 3:00 pm for 30 days in July – 2nd week in August

**Features/Salary/Benefits**:

* Positive working environment
* Salary increases for college credits/college degree/substitute teaching certification and/or NJ Teacher Certification
* Health benefits plan
* Employer paid Flexible Spending Account
* Retirement plan
* Option for waiver of health benefits payment
* Position could lead to advancement in teaching career
* Referral incentives
* Training Provided

**Job Requirements**:

* Experience working with students with autism and experience in ABA preferred, but not required
* Ability to communicate effectively
* Ability to work in a changing and challenging environment

**Highly competitive benefits and compensation**

**Equal Opportunity Employer / Minorities are encouraged to apply**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $22.50 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* working with special needs students: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Alpine Ocean Seismic Survey is seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our team. The Administrative Assistant facilitates the efficient operation of the Operations Department by performing a variety of clerical and administrative tasks.

title: Operator
description:
Job Purpose
To operate production machinery safely and efficiently; maintain appropriate documentation and communicate ideas and problems to appropriate staff; perform scheduled preventative maintenance and other repairs to production equipment; participate in production equipment changeovers; responsible for producing best quality product.
Safety* Follow all employer safety and health regulations as required by company policies, procedures and practices.
* Ensure the safe and efficient operation of all downstream equipment to meet or exceed company established safety culture.
* Follow Lock out/Block Out/ Tag out policy.
* Wear proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) where required.
* Proactive in addressing unsafe conditions and confronting unsafe behaviors in the facility.
* Address all unsafe acts or conditions immediately and report to Shift Production Supervisor.
* Participate and/or conduct safety training as scheduled.


Daily Operations* Monitor and explain deviation from expected Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE)
* Complete any machine and task specific training as documented on Operator Development Plan. Perform necessary Operator Checklists.
* Perform data collection of quality measurements as directed. Correct any deviations from quality standards in order to produce product within specifications.
* Monitor and respond accordingly to any deviations within SPC charting.
* Communicate problems, progress reports and continuous improvement ideas to management staff, maintenance and production personnel.
* Perform maintenance tasks as outlined by Maintenance Manager and in response to machine malfunctions. Troubleshoot machine and process issues.
* Responsible for personal development by establishing SMART goals, requesting regular meetings with their managers, volunteering for plant improvement teams, requesting additional training, requesting involvement beyond their immediate job responsibilities, seeking higher education opportunities including continuing education classes and meeting or exceeding their self-development and performance goals. Provide suggestions for training topics.
* Promote and participate in good housekeeping habits to ensure plant appearance exceeds management and customer expectations.
* Ensure all daily, weekly and periodic cleaning tasks are performed as outlined in the Master Cleaning Schedule.
* Maintain accurate production reporting documentation.
* Responsible for active participation on plant teams and activities including safety, quality, sustainability, community involvement, OEE, maintenance, employee wellness, brainstorming and continuous improvement which are required to create and maintain a World Class environment.
* Operate Powered Industrial Truck, Boom Lift and Scissor Lift per OSHA regulations rules and guidelines.


Quality/GMP/Food Safety* Responsible for producing and/or packing the best quality product at all times which meet or exceed company expectations and customer quality expectations.
* Ensure all production is properly labeled and/or tagged.
* Ensure all quality checks are properly completed and recorded in the Quality Monitor software or a plant specific form at the scheduled intervals.
* Ensure all non-conforming products are placed on hold with proper hold protocol is completed.
* Ensure all raw material lot numbers are properly obtained and recorded as required.
* Follow all Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP).
* Perform line sanitization tasks as outlined in the Master Sanitization Schedule and according to company procedures.
* Responsible for reporting quality, food safety, GMP, and food defense issues to their supervisor or a member of management.


Preventive Maintenance* Perform scheduled production equipment changeovers as outlined by the plant production schedule. Perform changeovers with limited impact to OEE.
* Perform scheduled Preventative Maintenance tasks as outlined by the plant PM program. Manage preventative maintenance tasks in Computerized Maintenance Management Software, as directed, including generating work orders.
* Proactive in addressing machine inefficiencies during preventative maintenance.
* Ensure equipment is clean and in ‘showroom condition’ after preventative maintenance is performed on production equipment.
* Continually evaluate equipment for improvement areas. Tag components or parts that need repair, replacement or improvement.
* Ensure production equipment is in safe and efficient operation after each changeover.
* Record parts removed from inventory on appropriate documentation and Computerized Maintenance Management Software to maintain sufficient parts inventory.
* Notify Maintenance Manager when parts inventory becomes low or reaches a reorder point.


Experience, Educational and Technical Qualifications
Our Operator should possess a sense of urgency, accountability, business ethics, professionalism, self-motivation and the desire and focus to improve the business.
Our Operator may be required to act as Person In Charge in the absence of a member of management.
Our Operator must possess a High School diploma or GED equivalent and successfully complete the entrance examinations and interviews.*Ring Container Technologies**is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of Ring to apply recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation and professional development practices without regard to actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), national origin, age (40 or older), disability or certain classifications based on genetic information.*

title: Dental Assistant Instructor
description:
**Position Description**

**Title:** Instructor

**Department:** Education

**Type:** Non-exempt

**Reports to:** Program Director/Director of Education

**Summary**: An Instructor or Faculty member cultivates the school’s mission and objectives through student instruction, guidance, and review in order to ensure the successful academic program and personal development of each student.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Program/Course
* Responsible for comprehensive course instruction within specified program
* Responsible for providing Program Director/Director of Education with active input in course development (i.e., course descriptions, syllabus creation, textbook material, or equipment review).
* Responsible for the creation and revision of daily lesson
* Responsible for continued professional growth by attending in-service training and/or continuing education seminars and to attend faculty meetings.
* Responsible for accurate record keeping of student attendance and academic
* Student Development
* Responsible for creating a classroom environment which fosters students’ academic growth and guides their professional development.
* Responsible for keeping DOE apprised of student progress (i.e., academic and attendance), especially in terms of performance trends detrimental to the development of a firm educational foundation (academic advisement and early warning forms).
* Responsible for providing extra help to those students experiencing difficulty in the mastery of course work.
* Responsible for advising students who have minor problems which may be thwarting educational Responsible for referring students whom have major problems to the Program Director/Director of Education.
* Correct and return quizzes, tests and lab assignments within 48 hours to
* Utilize instructional and audiovisual aids, and all available resources in the online
* Responsible to demonstrate utilization of community resources through arranging guest speakers, field trips and class participation in community service events.
* Report damaged, broken, or malfunction equipment immediately to the Program Director/Director of Education.
* Required to turn in grades within 48 hours of the end of term
* Perform other duties as required by the Program Director/Director of Education.

title: Assistant Consumer Insights Manager
description:
Assistant Consumer Insights Manager

  

Sep 6, 2024


New York, NY


Summary

At Chobani, we make sure every cup we sell meets a happy customer. We’re a dedicated team. And it’s easy to be dedicated when you’re a part of something much bigger than yourself. We’ve got an unbridled appetite for making a difference.

  

  

Chobani’s Category Development and Insights team uses category, consumer and shopper insights data to guide decisions made by the broader Demand Department – a united department that integrates marketing, sales, insights, product innovation and commercial finance. As a key member of the Demand Department, this role adds to driving company sales and gaining advantage over competitors by creating valuable tools/programs to uncover category and shopper insights that drive increased performance at retail.  



Responsibilities
* Conduct custom quantitative and qualitative primary research to answer critical business questions from Marketing, New Product Development, Creative, Sales, and other cross-functional partners
* Lead the end-to-end custom research process:
	+ Translate business questions into research objectives
	+ Design and implement analyses
	+ Use statistical skills to clean and analyze data
	+ Identify relevant trends within datasets and derive recommendations that promote unbiased evidence-based, data-driven decision-making
	+ Visualize the information and present findings, creating a cohesive story in a clear format that makes complex concepts accessible for all audiences
* Develop and embrace new research methodologies and approaches to produce actionable insights
* Be an internal source of expertise and excellence on research and insights, and the methods used to gain a greater understanding of our current & potential consumers
* Maintain research partner relationships, roadmaps, and capabilities
* Ad hoc business reporting necessary to answer time-sensitive questions
* Provide marketing intelligence, reporting, and analysis/synthesis in the areas of paid & owned media (TV, experiential, digital, social, website, etc.). Specifically:
	+ Evaluate and define metrics and frameworks
	+ Understand root causes of changes in metrics and communicate insights effectively
	+ Identify levers to move critical metrics
	+ Build and automate dashboards and reports
* Synthesize data from a variety of sources into actionable marketing recommendations and narratives at the organizational, campaign, channel, and tactic levels
* Lead marketing and media measurement: develop post-campaign analyses, assess return on investment across marketing tactics to inform future strategies/plans, and find opportunities to optimize marketing effectiveness and efficiency by using the Commercial Mix and other attribution models.
* Lead ongoing brand health tracking
Requirements
* Bachelor's degree required in statistics, economics, econometrics, analytics, or related field a plus
* 3-5 years of relevant experience within market research/consumer insights desired; experience in CPG industry preferred
* Experience with marketing analytics tools including marketing mix analysis, multi touch attribution, data management platforms, first party data onboarding, and brand lift studies.
* Experience working with syndicated sales data such as Nielsen or IRI data.
* Proficient user of Google Analytics
* Experience solving business objectives using a wide range of quantitative and qualitative research methods including but not limited to advertising/creative asset testing, product concept testing, consumer segmentation, brand tracking, social listening, surveying, focus groups, ethnographies, digital communities, IHUTs, IDIs, etc.
* Demonstrated ability in survey design (monadic, TURF, conjoint, MaxDiff, etc.), programming (i.e., Qualtrics), and analysis using statistical software tools (R/Python preferred, or willingness to learn)
* Experience with common statistical analysis methods (significance testing, regression modeling, hypothesis testing, multivariate analyses, forecasting/time series, etc.)
* Ability to weave together many data streams (primary research, 3rd party insights, syndicated data, etc.) into a cohesive and compelling story
* Ability to balance awareness of the “best” way to approach a research question with a passion for conducting scrappy research when appropriate
* Advanced Microsoft Office skills (including but not limited to Excel, Word, and Power Point)
* Excellent verbal, written, communication and presentation skills
* Keen attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to work in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and dynamic environment both independently and as a teammate
* Highly organized with the ability to balance multiple projects at once
About Us

Chobani is a food maker with a mission of making high-quality and nutritious food accessible to more people, while elevating our communities and making the world a healthier place. In short: making good food for all. In support of this mission, Chobani is a purpose-driven, people-first, food-and-wellness-focused company, and has been since its founding in 2005 by Hamdi Ulukaya, an immigrant to the U.S. The Company manufactures yogurt, oat milk, and creamers – Chobani yogurt is America's No.1 yogurt brand, made with natural ingredients without artificial preservatives. Following the 2023 acquisition of La Colombe, a leading coffee roaster with a shared commitment to quality, craftmanship and impact, the Company began selling cold-pressed espresso and lattes on tap at 32 cafes, as well as Ready to Drink (RTD) coffee beverages at retail.


Chobani uses food as a force for good in the world – putting humanity first in everything it does. The company’s philanthropic efforts prioritize giving back to its communities and beyond: working to eradicate child hunger, supporting immigrants, refugees and underrepresented people, honoring veterans, and protecting the planet. Chobani manufactures its products in New York, Idaho, Michigan and Australia, and its products are available throughout North America and distributed in Australia and other select markets.


For more information, please visit www.chobani.com and www.lacolombe.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.


*Chobani is an equal opportunity employer. Chobani will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on any basis including, but not limited to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military and/or veteran status, marital status, predisposing genetic characteristics and genetic information, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws.*

  


#LI-VK1



Compensation Range: $78,400.00 - $117,600.00, plus bonus.

title: Land Development Assistant
description:
**Job description**

**Overview**  
We are seeking a seeking a full-time Land Development Assistant to assist our Land Development Partner in our Short Hills, New Jersey office. In this role, you'll be at the heart of our real estate development activities, supporting the partner with crucial tasks for the purchase and approval of Multifamily construction projects, such as due diligence, loan closings, draws, and any other administrative support requested by the partner.

**Primary Responsibilities (including but not limited to):**

o Work on multiple residential and mixed-use projects.

o Due Diligence team support:

* Conduct comprehensive land use analysis and due diligence to assess project feasibility and regulatory requirements.
* Coordinate with legal, environmental, and engineering consultants to evaluate site constraints and opportunities.
* Identify and mitigate potential risks and obstacles related to land acquisition, entitlements, and development.
* Understanding construction loan draws, mortgages, budgets and proformas and ability to execute creation of documents required.

o Project Planning and Management support

* Coordinate with internal and external partners to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
* Understanding construction loan draws, mortgages, budgets and proformas and ability to execute documents required.
* Manage the work and schedule of the various land development and design teams including environmental, traffic and site engineers, planners, and architects.
* Establish and maintain project schedules, ensuring adherence to timelines and milestones.
* Coordination and execution of obtaining bids from subcontractors and reviewing agreements.

o Entitlements and Permitting Support

* Assist in the entitlement process, including zoning, planning approvals, and regulatory compliance.
* Prepare and submit land use approval applications, ensuring timely review and approval by relevant authorities.
* Coordinate with government agencies (State & local), community stakeholders, and project teams to address concerns and secure necessary approvals.

**Experience**

* Experience in residential land development, and strong knowledge and understanding of the development process
* Experience with creating proformas and budgets for construction loans and mortgages
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
* Advanced computer skills of the Microsoft office suite of products; spreadsheet analysis, project scheduling and data management software
* Must be detail-oriented and a problem-solver able to deal with complex situations
* A strong work ethic and commitment to excellence. Must take initiative, be resourceful, prioritize and perform within a team environment while maintaining focus and multitasking in a fast-paced, time sensitive environment

Job Type: Full-time

Application Question(s):

* Budgeting/Proforma: 1 year (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)
* Residential Land Development: 1 year (Preferred)
